description: Terrace fields are certainly nothing new in Southern China. Guangxi especially, where its rough terrain makes it an outright necessity in many parts of the province. Still, they are not easy technical feats and require significant investment before farmers can work them. After all, Guangxi is still very agrarian and there is little reason to believe that this will change in the near future.

name: Guangxi Ruled by Guangxi People
description: The province of Guangxi should be governed by the people of Guangxi. This is undisputable and even Guangdong recognises and even encourages the need for autonomy and self-rule.

name: Suppress Banditry
description: Banditry has been plaguing Guangxi since the Xinhai Revolution. Even before then, the province has a notorious history with bandits and it remains deeply-associated with them. This must change in order to modernise the province and develop it economically.

name: Enlighten the Minorities
description: Guangxi is home to many ethnic minorities. While they are all Chinese in the national sense, of course, the province will never be able to develop democratic traditions and self-rule if the minorities remain uneducated and poor. They must be involved if Guangxi is to become prosperous.

name: We Are Bandits!
description: Guangxi and banditry have a long and deep history together. Why should this tradition be broken? These Guangxi bandits remain known as some of the greatest warriors in China. We should embrace this identity, not destroy it, for it is what we truly are.

name: Embrace Regionalism
description: Guangxi is special and neither Beijing or even Guangzhou can tell us otherwise. We should focus on our province first and foremost and maintain our regional identity against centralist and assimilationist efforts.

name: Warrior Identity
description: Guangxi people are feared throughout China as unequaled soldiers. This has been true for millennia, and never rung truer than when Guangxi soldiers led the vanguard during the revolution and the brief Republic.

name: We Need Soldiers
description: Guangxi need soldiers. Always did, always will. Our people strive in warfare, and the Clique needs to stay influential in the region. We must improve our abilities to recruit people into the Provincial Army and train them to become the ferocious soldiers Guangxi is known for.

name: Militia Corps
description: The Militia Corps are, as the name obviously suggests, a militia recruited from the rural towns and villages of Southern China, often organised by local leaders and landowners. We should incorporate and formalise this system in order to secure our manpower sources.

name: Wolf Troops
description: Wolf Troops were special auxiliary troops from Guangxi during the Ming Dynasty. These troops quickly became notorious for their ferocity, violence and, more importantly, successes on the battlefield. They were often used to suppressed local rebellions and foreign excursions. Since then, the term has remained part of the Guangxi spirit to denote the province's elite soldiers.

name: Mountain Warfare Training
description: The terrain of Guangxi is rough and mountains are prevalent. As such, many people in the province are well-suited for mountain warfare, and formalising a training regimen and mountain infantry units will give us a technical edge in this specialised type of war.

name: Militarised Society
description: Guangxi has been known for militarism for a very long time and this was only further entrenched since the Xinhai Revolution. The province is becoming thoroughly militarised, which is a good thing considering our ambitions in the region.

name: Sparta of the East
description: Sparta is well-known to many Westerners: A highly-militarised society that prized martial prowess over everything else, where war dominated every aspect of Spartan life. While this remains relatively unknown to many Chinese, the monicker of \"Sparta of the East\" has stuck with foreigners and western-educated locals and it remains a rather apt one.

name: Guangxi Clique Dominance
description: Ma Ji's Guangxi Clique has emerged victorious in the Yue-Gui War. Continued militarisation is on the menu, that is certain. What is not certain is whether or not Guangxi will vie for national prominence or remain focused in regional politics.

name: Stabilise the Situation
description: It is clear that Guangdong does not welcome their conquerors. If we are to integrate them into our government, we will need to work with the locals and compromise with them. Stability is key, and winning the local elites over will help us in the long-run.

name: Exploit our New Lands
description: Guangdong is wealthy, but this wealth now belongs to Guangxi! What the locals think is of no importance; the continued growth of the Guangxi Army is paramount!

name: Further Militarisation
description: Under Chen Jiongming, Guangdong was significantly demilitarised, focusing on civilian undertakings instead. This trend must be reverted in order to further expand our forces.

name: Expand the Nanning Academy
description: The Nanning Military Academy dates from pre-Revolutionary times, training a large number of NCOs from Southern China, and the majority of Guangxi officers are graduates. With our expanding army, we must expand this institution to ensure quality officers are trained.

name: Border Raids
description: Guangxi has a history of bandits and raiders. This... tradition, so-to-speak, remains quite prevalent, and we can profit from it. In order to further sustain our large military, we can raid our neighbours to supplement our equipment.

name: Expansionism
description: Guangxi can only secure her future through conquest. Otherwise, we will be doomed to remain subservient to another government.

name: End the Yunnan Threat
description: Yunnan and Guangxi have been fighting for regional dominance since the Xinhai Revolution. We are well-aware that Yunnan was complicit with Li Zongren's invasion attempt, and they will now pay for their treachery.

name: Republican Glory
description: Guangxi was one of the first provinces to join both the Xinhai Revolution and the Constitutional Protection movement. Our future is intertwined with the Republic, and our recent history bathed in its short-lived glory. The Republic must be reborn, and Guangxi soldiers will be the republican vanguard!

name: Rapprochement with Yunnan
description: Our conflict with Yunnan cannot go on. For the good of the Republic, we must make ammends and bound together, or else we will be destroyed one by one by the vengeful Northerners.

name: Lu Rongting's Legacy
description: Lu Rongting was a brilliant man. Not only in military matters, but in personal relations and his eye for talent unmatched. Under him, the Guangxi Clique developed an open-minded and pluralist group that brought people in for their skill regardless of their background, as demonstrated by Lu's adopted sons and successors, a Hui Muslim and a Vietnamese.

name: Secure South China
description: Securing the south of the country will ensure that Liangguang will remain the dominant force in the region. This way, we will be able to secure our autonomy from the Central Government, or they will have to force us to bow.

name: Conquer Indochina
description: The radicals in Indochina are a threat to our government should they decide to spread their toxic ideology north. Their evil government must be toppled, replaced by one friendly to our interests to secure our southern border.

name: National Protection Alliance
description: In order to overthrow the corrupt and unconstitutional government in Beijing, the National Protection movement must be revived once more. Bringing together the leaders of the South will give us the power to finally reunify China once and for all.

name: Second Northern Expedition
description: We have gained significant momentum since assuming leadership of the National Revolution. We cannot lose it; we must press on! To Beijing! The Three Principles of the People will prevail!

name: A New China
description: With Beijing in our hands, we have finally secured our claim as the Central Government of China. Now, we can begin rebuilding a new Republic of China, one that will stand the test of time!

name: A Merchant Government
description: Chen Lianbo has emerged victorious! The Guangzhou Chamber of Commerce and the Merchant Corps have been able to overthrow the treacherous Guangxi Clique. Under the Cantonese merchants, Liangguang is on the path to economic prosperity above all, where wealth will flow, a glimmering star in a dark, chaotic void.

name: Merchant Corps Dominance
description: The Guangzhou Merchant Corps, the Chamber of Commerce's own defence force, has become one of the dominant forces in Chen Lianbo's Liangguang. Expectedly, they have become a favoured institution and their influence has grown significantly.

name: Strengthen Trade Protection
description: The Chamber of Commerce insists on reviewing many legislation enacted by Chen Jiongming's government. They are pushing for greater trade protection for Chinese merchants in Liangguang in order to ensure that wealth is created and remains in the hands of Chinese.

name: Suppress the Labour Movement
description: The labour movement in Guangdong has grown along with industrialisation, protected by Chen Jiongming's socialist policies. This cannot go on, as the labour movement continue to threaten the economic stability and prosperity of the province. After all, can these puppets of the Western Syndicalist powers be trusted in the first place?

name: Philantropy
description: Chen Lianbo is a philanthropist, which has made him beloved with the people. The new governor certainly does not intend to cut back on this generosity; he will continue to personally fund schools and hospitals, along with other large projects for the good of the people. Besides, it's very good PR.

name: Crush Guangxi Bandits
description: Banditry in Guangxi has been a thorn for the region's development. Their very presence is enough to hamper economic growth, something the Chamber of Commerce can no longer tolerate, and the Merchant Corps will ensure that trade is protected in the region.

name: Rapprochement with Yunnan
description: Our conflict with Yunnan cannot go on. For the good of the Republic, we must make ammends and bound together, or else we will be destroyed one by one by the vengeful Northerners.

name: The Chinese Washington
description: During the Merchant Corps Uprising, a Western commentator in Hong Kong described Chen Lianbo as the \"Chinese Washington\". He is certainly not the first one to have received that monicker, but it is certainly a positive one in the eyes of the West and helps our cause outside of China.

name: Secure South China
description: Securing the south of the country will ensure that Liangguang will remain the dominant force in the region. This way, we will be able to secure our autonomy from the Central Government, or they will have to force us to bow.

name: Conquer Indochina
description: The radicals in Indochina are a threat to our government should they decide to spread their toxic ideology north. Their evil government must be toppled, replaced by one friendly to our interests to secure our southern border.

name: National Protection Alliance
description: In order to overthrow the corrupt and unconstitutional government in Beijing, the National Protection movement must be revived once more. Bringing together the leaders of the South will give us the power to finally reunify China once and for all.

name: Northern Expedition
description: Invading the North is a very difficult feat, as demonstrated by the Kuomintang's attempt that led to their demise. It will require thorough planning, secured logistics and, of course, an army united in purpose. We will succeed where the KMT has failed and reunite the nation!

name: A New China
description: With Beijing in our hands, we have finally secured our claim as the Central Government of China. Now, we can begin rebuilding a new Republic of China, one that will stand the test of time!

name: New Guangxi Takeover
description: Li Zongren and his New Guangxi Clique have secured control over the two provinces. For the first time since 1925, the right-wing of the Kuomintang has a significant base of operations. The true National Revolution can now begin under the Generalissimo's leadership.

name: Three-Stage Revolution
description: Sun Yat-sen, our Party's founder, envisioned that the National Revolution would happen in three stages after the failure of the first Republic. We are still merely at the first stage, where the National Revolutionary Army must destroy the vestiges of Manchu tyranny and corruption. To this end, martial law must be enforced while the Party keeps tight control over institutions.

name: Reform the 7th Army
description: The 7th Army was the pride of the NRA. Under Li and with its recruits from Guangxi, it was the most successful army during the failed Northern Expedition, a beacon of hope despite the overall failure of the campaign. The Army must be reformed, its legacy enshrined as it once again carries the torch of National Revolution.

name: Dang Guo
description: \"Yi Dang Zhi Guo\", meaning \"using the party to run the state\", was the cornerstone of the first two stages of Sun Yat-sen's National Revolution where the Nationalist Party would rule as a dictatorship until the Revolution comes to a successful conclusion.

name: Republican Militarism
description: The National Revolutionary Army is one of the pillars of the Republic. Militarist sentiments must be cultivated and encouraged in order to create citizens loyal to the Republic of China and the Kuomintang.

name: Consolidating KMT Presence
description: The Kuomintang and the Productive People's Party has a relatively weak presense in Liangguang, formerly secured under Chen Jiongming's treacherous Federalists. With the help of the National Revolutionary Army and Party institutions, we will consolidate our presence before we can prepare for the continuation of Sun Yat-sen's National Revolution.

name: Sanmin Doctrine
description: The Three Principles of the People, or Sanmin Doctrine, is the basis of Sun Yat-sen's political philosophy and the Kuomintang. The Principles guide our government in its policies and decisions, and their importance must be understood by the people in the coming fight.

name: Focus on Minzu
description: Minzu, or Nationalism, is one of Sun Yat-sen's Three Principles of the People. National unity is paramount to our success, and shall be the Principle that we will focus on until we have reunited China. The other two will have to wait until China is liberated from monarchists and warlords.

name: Chen Mingshu's People's Government
description: Chen Mingshu and his Productive People's Party, an offshoot of the Kuomintang, have secured control of Liangguang and proclaimed the People's Government. While it does not oppose the Kuomintang's government in Fujian, it remains Wang Jingwei's more authoritarian leadership of the Party, wishing to focus on developing democracy in China.

name: Productive People’s Party Plan
description: The Productive People's Party's agenda does not differ significantly from the Kuomintang's, nor does it oppose Sun Yat-sen's vision. Chen Mingshu merely believes that the Party should focus on developing democratic institutions in China alongside pushing harder on land reform to create a truly free nation.

name: Promote Local Democracy
description: Ensuring that local democracy can flourish will ensure that, when the time comes, the people will have ample experience and understanding of democratic institutions once they are created on a national level. Only through experience and education can China become a democratic republic as Sun Yat-sen wanted.

name: Nationalist Land Reform
description: While the previous governor of Guangdong made significant headways towards a proper land reform program, it was not enough. Until the peasants of China own the land instead of leasing it from corrupt landlords, they will never be free.

name: Form the Route Armies
description: Route Armies are, in terms of size, similar to a Western field army. Reorganizing the NRA in Liangguang is paramount to the region's defence of the National Revolution and the Route Armies will form the basis of our large units as we move increasingly towards modernization.

name: Focus on Minquan
description: Minquan, or Democracy, is one of Sun Yat-sen's Three Principles of the People. Creating democratic institutions and preparing the Chinese people for them is the most important objective of the National Revolution and will, in the long-run, prove that the Party is the best choice for China.

name: Rebuild Whampoa
description: The Kuomintang Military Academy was first founded by Sun Yat-sen in 1924 in Whampoa (Huangpu) near Guangzhou. Officers trained there created a cadre of politically-conscious officers that would lead the NRA in the Revolution. With the Academy back in our hands, it is time to reinstitute it and resume training capable officers for the renewed Revolution.

name: Join the KMT Government
description: We found ourselves agreeable with the Kuomintang Central Committee in Fujian once more. With out differences settled and goals united, it is time we rejoined them for the good of the National Revolution.

name: Contest Leftist Rule
description: The Leftists in Fujian have diverged further and further from Sun Yat-sen's teachings, poisoning it with imperialist ideals, such as Syndicalism, incompatible with China. They must be destroyed and purged for the good of the Party and, more importantly, the Chinese people.

name: Claim Nationalist Leadership
description: The Central Committee in Fujian has been destroyed. It is our duty to pick up the torch of National Revolution and ensure that it continues burning bright until China is free- or die trying.

name: First Stage: Military Rule
description: Now that the National Revolution can resume in full force, it is time to enter its first stage: Military Rule. The Party will maintain order through the National Revolutionary Army until the country is reunited.

name: Alliance with the Landowners
description: The landowners have become weary as the Kuomintang has a history with land reform and expropriation. As their support is necessary for rural stability and supplying the NRA with manpower, we need to compromise with them and reassure them that they will not be expropriated and any changes in land policy will have their consent.

name: Threaten the Merchants
description: How many times will they have to learn this lesson?! We crushed them back in 1924, and we will crush them again! If they will not support the National Revolution, they are traitors, pure and simple, and their possessions will be turned to the Party.

name: Appease the Merchants
description: The Merchant Corps Uprising of 1924 caused instability in one of our most important city and delayed the Northern Expedition and likely contributed to its failure. We could use their support for the Revolution; surely we can find a compromise for the sake of China.

name: Land Rent Caps
description: It is time to pay lip-service to our revolutionary ideals, the Party's leftists and find a compromise between landowners and peasants. Caps on land rent will ease the burden of the peasants without angering the gentry or shaking the social order.

name: Secure the Southwest
description: Before we go north, we must secure the south. A Western Expedition is to be launched to secure Yunnan and Sichuan, bringing over their resources and republican supporters to our cause.

name: To Nanjing!
description: Nanjing is a city of great importance to the Kuomintang. As the \"southern capital\", it would help give legitimacy back to the Kuomintang beofre striking north.

name: Second Stage: Political Tutelage
description: With the country reunited, we enter the second stage: Political Tutelage. Martial law will be repealed in secured areas and power will move from the NRA to the Party and its civilian institutions. Of course, Li Zongren and the NRA will maintain significant influence on policy as the architects of our victory.

name: Revive China Program
description: Without the Nationalist Party, there will be no new China. A vast program of extensive state planning and initiatives is necessary to bring China back up to the same level as the West.

name: National Reconstruction Commission
description: Inspired by proposals drafted by Zhang Renjie, a centrally-directed National Reconstruction Commission should be formed by the Nationalist Government to plan a nationwide program of capital investments and standardizations. This program will involve multiple independently-scaling efforts centered around several major population centers.

name: First Industrialization Phase
description: The first planned phase of industrialization for each base region will involve expanding the infrastructural capacity and heavy industries needed for future construction.

name: Academica Sinica
description: To better foster the development of our native scientific capabilities, the KMT must commit to creating and sponsoring our own academic resarch institutions. Long proposed but never enacted, the fully established Academica Sinica will be the centre of these efforts.

name: Bo, Po, Mo, Fo...
description: The current methods for romanizing Mandarin Chinese and even teaching the Chinese script are woefully inadequate for children or the everyday person. A new standard for phonetic symbols, similar to the Hiragana syllabary created for Japanese, should be created and spread throughout our educational system to help standardize the Chinese dialects and open mass conversation with the West.

name: Second Industrialization Phase
description: The second planned phase of industrialization for each base region involves the development of factories reliant on fine tooling, such as consumer goods and military munitions.

name: First Unified Congress of the KMT
description: The Kuomintang is no longer a revolutionary party, but the government's party. With this new reality, a new Party Congress will be held to hammer out the road towards the Revolution's third and final stage, elect new members, and reorganize the party.

name: Empower the Military Affairs Commission
description: Li Zongren heads the Military Affairs Commission, the Party's organization that controls, well, military affairs. It had significant de facto powers during the Northern Expedition and the Party Chairman whishes to consolidate its influence over the civilian government and his position as Generalissimo.

name: Appoint a Premier
description: The Generalissimo cannot rule alone. As a military man, Li Zongren has limited legitimacy and appeal despite his massive popularity. Thus, he wants to appoint a Premier to lead the civilian government with the objective of promoting stability and his loyalty to Sun Yat-sen's ideals.

name: Build the National Mausoleum
description: It is long past due to honour those who have fallen in service of Chinese Democracy. A national mausoleum will be constructed outside of [Root.Capital.GetName] to house the remains of Sun Yat-Sen, Chiang Kai-Shek, and other prominent revolutionaries.

name: Organic Law of the Republic
description: While Political Tutelage continues and the final Constitution is drafted, the Organic Law of the National Government has been promulgated. This act reorganized the National Government into five branches, or Yuan, and reinforced the Kuomintang's exercise of sovereign power for the duration of Political Tutelage.

name: New Life Movement
description: The New Life Movement is a government-led civic movement created to stem the tide of ideological and political opposition to the National Government. This movement is heavily influenced by Confucianism and traditionalism and hopes to help promote social and national stability.

name: Promulgate the Constitution
description: The transition away from Political Tutelage is about to begin with the adoption of the Constitution. This will set the foundations of a unitary democratic republic with provisions for the Legislative Yuan to transition into an elected assembly once the Yuan's Preparatory Meeting deems it ready.

name: Nomadic Economy
description: Mongolia is a very nomadic economy, with half of the population living nomadic in the steppes. Our economy must be formed around this idea.

name: Uliastai Factory
description: Some of the cities of Mongolia must be developed industrially to help Mongolia develop. Uliastai is the perfect place to start.

name: Commission Military Factory
description: Our military industry is extremely poor, and must be developed if we are to survive independent.

name: Fund Nomad Development
description: Development of the nomadic groups is important, to help people thrive in the steppes.

name: Expand Urga's Industry
description: Urga is our largest city, and is still relatively small compared to most other capital cities across the world. Its industry and infrastructure must be increased.

name: Khovd Factory
description: Khovd is another main city that is in urgent need of industrial development.

name: Weapons Development
description: Our weapons are of an extremely poor standard, and research must be done to develop new weaponry.

name: The Trans-Mongolian Railway
description: The Trans-Mongolian Railway has been a plan for many years, creating a massive railway across the steppes. With our territory expanding, we can connect these new areas to be centered around Urga.

name: Urga Officer School
description: An officer school in Urga itself will help increase the standard of our officers.

name: The Mongolian Military
description: The Mongolian military is dominated by mounted troops, due to the vast flat steppes of the nation. Our military must be expanded, with China breathing down our necks.

name: Further Military Development
description: More military factories are needed to help supply the troops.

name: New Production Techniques
description: New modern techniques in producing weapons must be researched, to allow us to easily supply our troops with up to date arms.

name: Review our Methods
description: The methods of our military should be looked into, to see whether we could reform our military to become more effective.

name: Work With Our Territory
description: We must understand that the territory of our nation is very difficult, either flat steppes or steep hills and mountains.

name: Recruitment Effort
description: We need to start a new recruitment plan to fill up our army numbers.

name: Nomadic Recruitment Policy
description: A new policy to recruiting the nomadic people of Mongolia is necessary to fill our army.

name: Tribal Recruitment Policy
description: Some of the far away tribes must also be recruited, to fill our army numbers.

name: Train our Officers
description: Our officers lack good training, and so a new training policy is necessary.

name: Develop Radio Technology
description: Radio and electronic technology has great potential to help solve the divide in Mongolia, and so must be researched.

name: Ungern's Mongolia
description: Mongolia, for now, remains in the hands of the Baron Ungern-Sternberg. Though thid position is threatend by fast-moving political currents. Ungern must act now if he is to remain in his position.

name: Bribe the Princes
description: Though the nobles are opposing our government currently, we can easily take some of the less loyal nobles by bribing them. The princes should be so pliant towards conformity after decades of chinese supression.

name: Purge the Princes
description: The Princes have always been a problem, holding far too much influence in Mongolian government. It is time they see their end.

name: Ignore the Princes
description: The princes are not truly the issue we are facing. We must focus on other avenues, and perhaps even get support from them in defeating other factions.

name: Nobility Assist in Destroying Buddhists
description: Using the Princes vast wealth, they have agreed to help us crush some of the buddhist resistance in Urga.

name: Nobility Assist in Destroying Democrats
description: Using the Princes vast wealth, they have agreed to help us crush some of the socialist resistance in Urga.

name: Impose Authoritarian Ideas
description: Many in Urga currently believe that perhaps it is time for democracy. The problem is that they do not realise how wrong they are, and must be disciplined to stop democracy from infesting the whole of the nation.

name: Display Ungern's Buddhism
description: Many in Mongolia do not believe Ungern-Sternberg is committed enough to protecting buddhism and acting in a buddhist lifestyle. Some public displays of him and some loyal monks meditating and holding some speeches should convince them otherwise.

name: The New Buddhist Icon
description: Though Ungern-Sternberg is not a tulku like the Bogd Khan, he should still be known as a buddhist figure of almost equal importance in Mongolia. Fortunately foundational work like the Tibetan Agvan Dorzhiev's work 'The Shambhala Prayer' is already well known and easy material to manipulate for propaganda.

name: Cult of Personality
description: To make sure Ungern-Sternberg remains in power, the propaganda around his cult of personality should be temporarily increased massively. This cult of personality relies on mythmaking that officer Ossendowski is adept at spinning.

name: Enforce Officer Loyalty
description: The officer class is a hotbed for noble traitors, socialist rebels and buddhist extremists. Their loyalty should be tested and hardened to root out these issues. To the general staff, this measure also helps restrict the ability of russian politics to influence their decisionmaking.

name: Urga Military Parade
description: Nothing gets the peoples support and shows dominance more than a military parade. To the people of Urga, a military parade is more of a holiday than a display of power, owing to the newness of the concept. Regardless of whether the crowd is satiated by fun or fear, it will help secure our rule in the city.

name: Arrest Any Opponent
description: Though before we had strict laws about opposition, it is obvious these laws aren't strict enough. The prisons should be overflowing with opponents before the nation is safe.

name: Ungern Secures Power
description: Finally, Ungern-Sternberg and his Russian military clique have defeated the opposition, and have once again taken the reigns of the nation. Renewed by the vigor of military victory, the Russian-led junta is ready to make their postulations into reality.

name: A Democratic Mongolia
description: Now is the time for change. We must seize the chance, and inspired from other democracies of the east, bring Mongolia to the democratic world.

name: Circulate Pro-democratic Leaflets
description: In such a traditional society that Mongolia is, many people do not know the modern ways of socialism and democracy. Leaflets should be distributed to teach them the way.

name: Ungern, the Traitor
description: Some in Mongolia truly believe that the butcher Ungern-Sternberg is good for Mongolia! An anti-Ungern propaganda campaign should be started, informing people of how brutal the Barons rule has been.

name: Peasant March in the Capital
description: It is time for the peasants voices to be heard! A march through the capital should show that the people must be heard, and we will wait no longer!

name: Seize the Nobles Wealth
description: The noble princes get their power and influence through their money, money they earned exploiting the people of this nation. Their wealth should be seize indiscriminately to help the people.

name: Co-operate with Monasteries
description: The monasteries, the more neutral ones at least, are not our enemies, and we should try to work with them to destroy radical buddhist influence and help promote socialism and democracy.

name: Remove Corrupt Aristocrats
description: The aristocratic princes are what is keeping the people down! Their corruption cannot go unpunished, and they must be removed from their posts.

name: Remove Russians from Government
description: Many Russian nationals still work in our government, holding secret sympathies to the Baron. They must be removed to keep our regime safe.

name: Declare a Constitutional Monarchy
description: Finally, we have succeeded! Democracy and socialism has won in Urga. Now, we must work on transforming the nation into a democratic and equal society.

name: The Nobility Take Power
description: The noble princes of Mongolia, who have ruled Mongolia for years throughout history, have taken power once again, and must act fast to secure their rule.

name: Pander to Buddhists
description: Religion is not a major point for the princes, but for the populus it is very important. Appealing to buddhists will help weaken the power of the Buddyn Zövlöl.

name: Destroy the Buddyn Zövlöl
description: All of our resources must be used to crush the power of the Buddyn Zövlöl, to stop their radicalist buddhism from coming to power and threatening our rule.

name: Silence the Impoverished
description: The imporverished peasants of Mongolia are not important enough to have a voice. They are trying to force their way into power to steal our money and bring the country into chaos. They must be silenced.

name: Empower Landowners
description: Rich landowners are some of our main supporters in Mongolia, and control much of the land that many peasants work on. They should be empowered in law to help stop the peasant uprising.

name: Pay off Disloyal Officers
description: Many of the officers of our army lacks loyalty to our government. Using our vast wealth, we should bribe some of them to increase their loyalty.

name: National Citizen Guard
description: Many of the peasants do support our regime, as they know they are unable to make the right decision themselves and trust us to handle it. We should form the National Citizen Guard, a group of peasant militia to fight against rebel peasants.

name: Princes Personal Guard
description: Many of the princes have a personal guard to protect themselves. These guards should be organised more to fight off rebels.

name: The Aristocratic Kingdom
description: Finally, our aristocratic class has taken full power once again, after having to share it with the Baron Ungern-Sternberg. We can now turn Mongolia back to nationalism and traditionalism.

name: Buddhist Revolution
description: Mongolia is at its core a buddhist nation. Now, the buddhist council has taken power, to steer the nation back to pure buddhist nationalism.

name: Declare the Nobles Traitors
description: The people listen to the lamas of Mongolia, and see them as trustworthy authority figures. The people must be informed that the noble princes are traitors to Mongolia.

name: Arrest the Noble Council
description: The Noble Council, led by Demchugdongrub, are an evil group of traitors. They must be arrested and stopped.

name: Slander Ungerns Buddhism
description: The Mad Baron Ungern-Sternberg pretends to be a buddhist icon. However, he is not even fully buddhist at all, and does not have Mongolian roots. The people must be taught that they are being lied to.

name: End Russian Influence
description: Russian influence is pervasive in Mongolian society. This link must be cut, so that we can act alone.

name: Distribute Aid through Monasteries
description: The people who are struggling after the previous government abandoned them need help. We should give out aid through the monasteries to gain their support.

name: Empower the Monasteries
description: The monasteries are the cornerstone of Mongolian society. They should be protected and empowered.

name: Persecute non-Buddhists
description: Non-buddhists are generally rebellious types, fighting against our government. They do not belong in Mongolian society and the main ones should be persecuted.

name: The Theocratic State
description: Finally, Buddhism has won in Mongolia. We can now push to transform Mongolia to a religious theocracy much like that of Tibet or Bhutan.

name: The Provisional Government
description: With the core of China under our control, we have set up a new Provisional Government that will work on a new, hopefully permanent, constitution and create a united Republic that will stand the test of time.

name: Strenghten Parliament
description: Democrats all over China agree that Parliament must be strengthened to secure democracy in the country and ensure that authoritarians are unable to usurp power in the young Republic once again.

name: Empower the Presidency
description: The failure of the previous republican government shows that the government's powers must be clearly defined and the importance of the presidency to ensure stability and proper governance.

name: Federalist Model
description: The Federalist movement in China has risen and fallen several times since the Xinhai Revolution, but they remain an important movement in our provisional government. A federal system will ensure that powers are properly separated and that local affairs remain in the hands of the locals who understand their own problems better than any central government.

name: Attack Provincialism
description: Provincialism is a tool to divide our nation into fiefdoms and federalism is an attempt to institutionalize this. The supremacy of the central government must be ensured, for it is the only way China will be properly reunited as a single nation and not a collection of local tyrants.

name: Legacy of Xinhai
description: The Xinhai Revolution marks the birth of modern China and the Republic. It and its revolutionaries must be honoured and commemorated, as their legacy will live on as long as our Republic lives.

name: National Protection Legacy
description: The National Protection movements have become a symbol of our leaders' and armies' commitment to republicanism and constitutionalism, and they should be honoured along with the Xinhai Revolution that birthed our Republic, as they made sure that the Republic survived.

name: The New Republic
description: With the lessons from the old Republic, we can build a new Republic can be built. A new order in China, one that truly respects the legacy of its founders, republicanism, constitutionalism, and democracy, will be born and, this time, endure.

name: Personality Cult
description: [Root.GetLeader] is the sole reason that the National Protection Alliance was able to crush the monarchists, radicals, and pretenders and restore the legacy of the Xinhai Revolution. Without him, there would be no Republic, and his legacy as liberator of China will endure.

name: The New Bureaucracy
description: From ruling a province or two to ruling the core of China, our bureaucracy has been struggling to say the least. Whether we adopted a federalist or centralist model, new civil servants need to be hired and the entire service must be reorganized from scratch.

name: New National Assembly Election
description: The new government cannot hope to act legitimately as a Republic without assembling a new Parliament. New election to the National Assembly are to be held for the first time in decades (discounting illegitimate ones by the Manchu tyrants of course), helping bring legitimacy to our Provisional Government.

name: National Reunification
description: With a new National Assembly gathered and a new Constitution ratified, our government is no longer provisional, but the sole legitimate government of China. President [Root.GetLeader] will lead the nation towards National Reunification, and China will be once again united and free. Long live the Republic!

name: Reintegrate Academies
description: Military academies are scattered throughout China since before the Xinhai Revolution and have largely developed independently since the first collapse of the Qing Dynasty. They must be reintegrated and the curriculum of all officers standardized once more.

name: Standardized Arsenals
description: For several decades, the arsenals of China have been under the control of different and largely independent provincial and national governments. Now that a number of those arsenals are under our control, the logistical issues stemming from different arsenals producing different arms in different calibre for a single army are substantial and should be rectified as soon as possible.

name: Fate of Northern Officers
description: Since the defeat of the Northern warlords, we have many officers as prisoners of war. Chen Jiongming believes we should be lenient, as many of them are competent and the majority are willing to pledge their allegiance to the new Republic. Not many share this optimism, however, and that they should serve as an example as traitors to China

name: Small Arms Development
description: Despite attempts by the numerous national and provincial governments to upgrade, the most widespread rifle in service remains the venerable, yet severely obsolete, Model 88. Making the standardization on a new, modern rifle a reality rather than a project on paper is a top priority in order to improve our lackluster military capabilities compared to other modern militaries.

name: Army Motorization
description: As the infrastructure of a unified China improves, not only is motorization becoming a possibility, it is becoming a necessity due to the very size of our country. Increasing our mobility will increase our capabilities on and off the battlefield, allowing for greater flexibility and reach- especially in remote areas where bandits continue to prowl.

name: Artillery Modernization
description: Artillery is the king of the battlefield and modern pieces were a luxury in the warlord era. With the capabilities of a united China, we can modernize our guns and bring our firepower closer to the global standard.

name: Army Support and Logistics
description: Amateurs study tactics, masters study logistics. With a country as large and varied as China, this proverb must be taken seriously as many warlords learned the hard way. Improving our logistics will improve our armies' fighting capabilities far more than any modern firearm.

name: A Tank Arsenal
description: The development of armoured warfare has certainly been noticed in China, but to to develop and use them here was but a pipe dream. Now that we are united and stronger than ever, now is the time to dwelve into these advanced technologies. An arsenal dedicated to armoured vehicles should be founded as an important stepping stone in China's modernization.

name: Formalize Aviation Schools
description: While there are indeed schools for pilots in China, they are few and relatively disorganized. Formalizing these schools and creating a proper curriculum for pilots and maintenance crews will help create a proper air force for China.

name: New Aircraft Factories
description: The South of the country has seen a number of small aircraft workshops created in the last decade or two, but remained fairly small, only able to repair what few planes there were. Creating proper factories is another step towards developing a fledging aeronautics industry, a staple of the modern era.

name: Domestic Fighter Design
description: There have been a number of attempts at creating a Chinese aircraft, mostly based on foreign designs. With the help of foreign experts and an increasing pool of local technicians, we are now more than ever able to develop our own designs in the hopes of creating a modern air force to defend our skies.

name: Tactical Bomber Fleet
description: Medium tactical bombers offer versatility to an air force with the ability to accomplish different types of mission. Of course, designing such a large plane has been unheard of until now and will certainly be a challenge.

name: Army Air Support
description: Light bombers as some kind of flying artillery is the best way an air force can support land operations. It is only logical that we focus on these close-air-support crafts as we forge a modern air force.

name: Southern Fleet's Legacy
description: The Guangdong (or Southern) Fleet had a short and tumultuous history. Created in the late 19th century, its funding was siphoned towards the Nanyang Fleet in Shanghai, achieving little in the Sino-French and Sino-Japanese Wars, and was unceremoniously disbanded before the Xinhai Revolution. Nevertheless, it was one of the four modern fleets of China and its legacy endures in local memory.

name: Revive the Naval Academies
description: The naval academies of China have been largely neglected through successive national and provincial governments. Now that there is a single, uncontested Central Government once more, we have the ability to renew naval interests and support a new cadre of officers for the Republican Navy.

name: Modern Destroyer Flottila
description: Destroyers are the backbone of any modern navy, especially one as fledging as China's. They will protect our coasts, shipping lanes and larger warships from submarines and small attack crafts.

name: Develop Submarines
description: Submarines are proving to be indispensable in modern naval warfare. For a navy as limited as ours, they may prove to be a life saver, allowing us to attack far stronger enemies by raiding their shipping lanes and harassing their larger fleets.

name: Cruisers for our Fleet
description: Cruisers are important for scouting and screening and, realistically speaking, may be the largest warships we are capable of building at this time.

name: Focus on Coastal Defence
description: It would be insane to start planning for a large fleet capable of rivaling the naval Great Powers. As such, we must focus on a more flexible navy capable to protecting our long coast and interests in the Pacific.

name: A Grand Fleet?
description: If China is to be considered a Great Power as it rightfully should be, a navy is indispensable. While it will certainly be a very long-term plan, our great navy must start somewhere and it must start now.

name: Naval Bomber Project
description: While ignored at first, naval bombers armed with torpedoes and armour-piercing bombs are quickly becoming a serious threat to even the largest warships currently at sea. This technology might be exactly what China needs: A cost-effective way of destroying a vastly-larger enemy fleet threatening our coastline.

name: Aftermath of Black Monday
description: Black Monday shockwaves have hit the Dutch economy hard. It is clear that the government will be forced to take immediate and drastic action to avoid the economy breaking down completely.

name: Plan for Labour
description: Het Plan van de Arbeid, or 'Plan for labour' is a social-democratic strategy to deal with the fallout of Black Monday by committing to large public works and government spending in order to combat rising unemployment.

name: Public Works
description: By investing in public projects like the construction of canals, city parks and highways, we will be able to restore the purchasing power of the common man, who would otherwise be unemployed, while also getting improved infrastructure in return.

name: Extend Unemployment Subsidies
description: Owing to Black Monday, more people are unemployed than ever before. While the conservative and especially the liberal governments of the last decades have implemented basic unemployment subsidies, they were afraid to discourage working if they made the rates too high; couple that with inflation and everyone living of these subsidies is impossible.

name: Finish Rijksweg 12
description: During the German golden age under Tirpitz, plans for building a highway connecting The Hague with the German border were already considered, though it ended up only reaching as far as Oudenrijn. Extending the Rijksweg to the German border would serve as a powerful symbol of our government's commitment to other national infrastructure projects.

name: Limited Working Week
description: The minimum working week is too long, and as a result employers cannot afford to hire as many as they otherwise could. By shortening the working week, employers will be forced to hire more people, thus allowing more people to earn a living.

name: Improve the Afsluitdijk
description: The Afsluitdijk was finished in the early thirties and closes off the Zuiderzee, turning the Ijsselmeer into an inland bay. The risk of the dike breaking could have disastrous effects however, so investing in securing its structural integrity could hardly hurt. Furthermore it would also deliver much-needed work for unemployed people.

name: Privatisation of Projects
description: Our investments have borne fruit: companies are expressing their interest in taking over some of our national projects in hopes of making a profit off of them. In order to do this, they will need to hire people, who will in turn spend more money. While we have not fully recovered from Black Monday yet, this will surely be the beginning of the end of our nation's suffering.

name: Implement a Monetarist Approach
description: Socialists and Conservatives alike call us mad, but the best approach is not to intervene directly and let the market fix itself while we help by devaluing the Guilder and opening up more opportunities for our import-export sector, the beating heart of our economy.

name: Drop the Gold Standard
description: We adhere to the Gold Standard so that investors will see the Guilder as a stable currency that can always be turned in for gold at the central bank. An unfortunate side-effect of having a strong Guilder is that it makes it expensive for people from other countries to purchase Dutch products. By dropping the gold standard and devaluing the Guilder we can mitigate these effects.

name: Trade Missions
description: Trade missions seeking to reach agreement with foreign governments and companies are a great way to expand the reach of Dutch business and potentially alleviate the current economic downturn.

name: West Indies Trade Hub
description: The West Indies are ideally situated to be a trading post for trade with the western hemisphere. The America's, far away from Germany's sphere of influence, can also provide a chance to diversify our exports, which is currently overly focussed on the Kaiserreich.

name: Loan to Shell
description: Royal Dutch Shell has been through a series of rough years during the 1920s. While other Dutch companies prospered, Shell suffered the catastrophic loss of their British holdings in the Revolution of 1925, a situation only alleviated by our accession to the German economic sphere of the Reichspakt. We can give them a loan that will surely turn into an investment beneficial for both parties.

name: Loan to SBM
description: The Surinaamse Bauxiet Maatschappij is a mining company in Dutch Guyana. By giving them a loan they will be able to expand their activities on the South American continent and hopefully deliver us more military-critical resources than ever before.

name: Return to Pre-Crisis Export Rates
description: Our efforts to make Dutch companies as lucrative as possible have borne fruit: export rates are returning to pre-crisis levels, and in some sectors even exceed these levels. In order to handle the workload, companies are forced to hire more people, resulting in more spending power for the common man. While this may not amount to full recovery yet, it is possible to see a bright horizon ahead of us.

name: Werkfonds
description: The best way to work ourselves out of the Black Monday malaise will be by keeping the government balance positive and the Guilder strong. In turn, we can invest the excess money saved into public works projects, but contrary to the social-democratic plan, without forcing gargantuan debts upon our beleaguered treasury.

name: Werkverschaffing
description: To combat the crisis of rampant unemployment unleashed by Black Monday, the government has decided to expand its labour programme.

name: Cut Employment Benefits
description: More and more people are sacked from their workplace, and the treasury is increasingly stretched by their demand for subsidies and benefits. If we are not to end up with a monstrous debt at the end of this, we must cut down the money available.

name: Cut Employers' Red Tape
description: One of the factors that pushes Dutch industry behind foreign competition is our raft of highly sophisticated yet burdensome safety regulation. It's sad, but we cannot afford such things in these times of crisis.

name: A Country of Canals
description: By building canals all over the Netherlands we will keep our unemployed populace working while rejuvenated businesses will profit from the canals and the infrastructure it brings in the future.

name: A Park For Every Town
description: Another manner to keep our unemployed busy is by building a lot of parks. Generations yet unborn will be able to come to their senses in these tranquil sites, that will have been built in these hard times.

name: Unemployment Reduced
description: Our werkverschaffing-programme has borne fruit: day after day, less people come to stamp as proof that they are in fact unemployed and not claiming their subsidies as free extra money on top of their regular salary. It seems we succeeded, and while we have not fully recovered yet from Black Monday, the worst of the crisis' effects seem to have abated.

name: National Recovery
description: Plutocratic incompetency has resulted in the collapse of our economy. At the same time, the world becomes increasingly unsafe. If we invest fully in the defensive and offensive capabilities of our country that too will help the economy grow again, but then with construction that will actually help our country's security in the future.

name: Defence Spending Spree
description: We shall bring our military back to the level of the rest of the world. Socialists and other unpatriotic folk are saying that the military should be the last place the government should invest in these times but we shall prove them wrong!

name: Factory Building
description: By building more factories the nation will be able to increase its domestic military production. While we are a transit country it can never hurt to invest in other sectors as well.

name: Draft the Able-Bodied
description: Many so-called unemployed claim they cannot find work to do; at the same time, we cannot find people to defend the fatherland. This paradoxical situation will end now. If you want to receive money from the state then you'll have to do something for it if you can, even if it will mean that our soldiers will be slightly less motivated.

name: The Rhine Line
description: Ever since the inception of the Communard regime in France the godless syndicalists have been plotting our destruction and that of our German neighbour. The Rhine is a significant obstacle to this end and if we were to strengthen it with forts, provided God blesses us, there will be no foreign syndicalist setting foot on Dutch soil north of the Rhine.

name: The Grebbeline
description: We cannot just trust that the Germans will block dirty syndicalists from crossing their part of the Rhine. By building fortifications in the Grebbe area we can, even in such a dire case as total German collapse, defend the cultural-economic heart of Holland.

name: More Purchasing Power
description: Our large investments in the military is resulting in people finding work across a number of sectors, ranging from the production of weapons to serving in the army themselves. As a result they have money to spend, which is now slowly kickstarting the recovery of other sectors as well. While we have not fully recovered from Black Monday yet, we are certain that this is the beginning of the end of the suffering.

name: Recovery from Black Monday
description: Our sound strategy to fight the economic collapse that ensued after Black Monday has resulted in the stabilisation of our economy. In all sectors, more people are employed, more products are sold and increasing liquidity is floating around. It seems we succeeded in guiding the country through a hard time, and people are confident in the future once again.

name: Repay Government Debts
description: It is an unfortunate fact of life that money does not grow on trees, and the government has been forced to issue a number of bonds and requested loans from foreign investors in order to fill the void. It is imperative that we pay these debts off sooner rather than later.

name: Control Inflation
description: With inflation still uncomfortably high as a result of Black Monday we must enact deflationary measures to get it under control, for example by demanding that bank reserve rates be increased so that they are forced to hold onto more capital. Such actions will help stop our freshly rescued economy from overheating.

name: Restore Pre-Crisis Regulations
description: The somewhat brutal policies of the Black Monday years have served their purpose well, incentivising business and getting government spending. All the same, it is vital that we restore our nation's lost confidence by restoring some of their long-deserved privileges.

name: Startup Tax Breaks
description: Small and medium sized businesses, or 'SMEs' are the bedrock upon which Holland's greatness rests. With many of them being unable to survive the recent tumult in our economy there is a void to fill, and if we are to inspire entrepreneurial spirit we must offer tax incentives to these small firms.

name: Eastern Industrialisation
description: Imports from Germany and the borderlands are the future. By investing in that region we shall be able to benefit from cross-border trade and encourage a number of new businesses to open.

name: Northern Industrialisation
description: We have already established funds to help businesses in the north of the country. All that remains for us to do now is to open it up to applications

name: Consolidate the Arms Industry
description: Our recent efforts to incentivise small businesses are already paying off, particularly in the domestic sphere. All the same, it is vital now that we encourage a number of small military firms to come together to enable them to make a meaningful contribution to our military sector.

name: Guns for the Reichspakt
description: As we are considered a relatively impartial third party, we find ourselves in the useful position of being able to sell weapons to whomever we desire. The Kaiserreich is the leading hegemon of continental Europe, and it needs guns. We can oblige them.

name: Guns for the Entente
description: Though perhaps we do not share the Entente's proclivity for mindless violence and short-sighted decision making, we do share their love of arms - so long as it involves them paying us of course.

name: Side with Big Business
description: It goes without saying that our large corporations are vital to our future economic success. Only economies of scale will allow us to prosper as a nation, and as such we should consider offering a variety of tax breaks and state subsidies to a number of our leading corporations.

name: Subsidise Philips
description: Philips is one of our most famous corporations, and a global player in the electronics market. By subsidising their developments and research, and engaging in joint ventures with them we can harness them for our own state uses.

name: Investments in Spyker
description: Though Spyker has had its ups and downs, its military value makes it a key player in our country. By investing in a majority shareholding in the firm we would be able to take advantage of its automotive prowess to develop mechanised technology.

name: Fokker Loans
description: The infamous Fokker company was responsible for a great deal of Central Powers war materiél during the Weltkrieg, and as such we should not overlook its importance as a potential driver for improving our own air force in the near-future.

name: Purchase Unsold Civilian Planes
description: Not every product that gets developed is a best seller, unfortunately. At the very least it gives us the opportunity to have access to some planes at a very low price.

name: Fokker Fiscal Deal
description: By investing further capital into Fokker we can enable them to increase their military production output, itself having a wider effect on the nearby arms industry.

name: New RnD Facilities
description: The wars of the future will be won by a combination of laboratory nerds and government oversight. With both, we might just have a chance at boosting our research capabilities.

name: Economic Boom
description: With just the right amount of interference and hands-off approach, our economy has become less a shadow of its former self, than an outright phoenix. Holland is standing strong, and our nation is booming.

name: Dutch Foreign Policy
description: Now that we have stabilised our political order, it is time to look outwards again and examine whether we should re-emphasise our self-imposed neutrality or find allies in this new hostile world.

name: Join the Reichspakt
description: Ever since the Boer War, we have been drifting towards the German cause, and if the Reichspakt falls to the godless syndicalists then we are likely finished as well. Let us fight for our own fate instead of having it forced upon us!

name: Third Hague Convention
description: The Netherlands are internationally famed as a neutral arbiter between nations. In a time of great global transition, we must play our part as a member of the international community by providing a safe place for negotiations.

name: The Koninkrijksstatuut
description: The time has come to give some measure of autonomy to our colonies. We will need all of the help we can get from them.

name: Proclaim Neutrality
description: The Netherlands suffers from enough troubles without joining a devastating global conflict. We shall work with whomever reigns supreme after the conflict, as we have done many times before.

name: Join the Entente
description: The Entente long seemed an unlikely choice for an alliance. The British struggle in South Africa ensured a negative view of the United Kingdom permeated throughout all layers of Dutch society. The world turns, however, and changing geopolitics means our stance must shift.

name: Join the Internationale
description: If we are to do our part in the struggle against reactionaries, monarchism and the tyranny of imperialism, we must join the wider Internationale in their standoff against enemies no matter where they are found.

name: Belgium Policy
description: With our political crisis finally ended, it is time to consider our position on the Belgian Question.

name: One Dutch Nation, One Dutch State
description: Flanders remaining outside of the Dutch state is a historical oddity and nothing more. We must have returned to us what is rightfully ours. Dutch nationals must be part of the Dutch nation-state.

name: Conference of Baerle
description: The time has come for us to negotiate the future of the Benelux region. The world is in crisis and there is no time for division.

name: Aansluiting or Death!
description: We will take Flanders back. That is a fact that is not lost on our people, and thousands are marching in the streets for it. We cannot disappoint them or else our nation is lost.

name: Friendship with the Belgian Regime
description: The Benelux must not be torn asunder by petty grievances. The Netherlands and Belgium shall be good friends.

name: Research Agreement with Belgium
description: We can go further than simply proclaiming our friendship with Belgium. By investing in tangible benefits such as cross-border research, both of our nations can prosper.

name: Dutch Research Institute
description: With Flanders in friendly hands, we can combine our research and share it faster with local scientists using the Dutch language. This will be a great boon to our research capabilities.

name: South Africa Policy
description: South Africa is populated by a number of Dutch-descent Boers, making its political fate in these troubled times particularly concerning to our own domestic political scene. There have been a number of calls from all sides of the left-right spectrum to consider our approach

name: Help the Boers
description: The Boers are our brethren, and we cannot abandon them now.

name: South African Government in Exile
description: We must go beyond mere platitudes. The Boers are, at the very least, our cousins, and as such we should propose to allow them to have a home from which to proclaim their legitimacy.

name: Research Agreement with the Boers
description: There are elements within the South African scientific community made up of Boers that are great supporters of ours. We can unite our efforts with theirs to improve our own research capacity.

name: Abandon the Boers
description: The Boers are a relic of a different age. We cannot keep moping over lost dreams forever.

name: Research Agreement with the Dominionists
description: One boon of letting go of the past is that we can make new friends. The Dominionists in South Africa are grateful for our refusal to support the Boers, and so may be willing to sign up to joint-research.

name: The Dutch Army
description: The Netherlands does not need anyone to tell them about how to manage an effective military. All the same, with the fell winds of conflict on the horizon, it is important that we give greater thought to the long-term future of our army.

name: Dutch Boots
description: Our infantrymen are the bedrock on which our army is based. We must give them all of the support we can so that they aren't forced to march into battle with little more than broomsticks and sandals.

name: New Machine Guns
description: Our machineguns belong in a museum, and it is high time we acquire some new ones!

name: Focus on Defence
description: Our land is a brutal morass, a place of swamps, marshes and sturdy men. By playing to the Netherlands' strengths, we shall make our enemies bleed for every inch they take.

name: Expand the Artillerie Inrichtingen
description: The Koninklijke Artillerie Inrichtingen are vital for our army. We need to reopen production lines so we can start replacing our old equipment with modern materiel.

name: New Anti-Tank Guns
description: If we are to hold out against a superior foe, we need weapons capable of penetrating even the mightiest of Panzers. We must invest into anti-tank weaponry and its research.

name: Artillery Modernisation
description: Our defensive measures have no use if we have no big guns to back them up. And these guns from the 19th century we have now will make nice museum pieces.

name: Reinforce our Divisions
description: With guns, boots, artillery and anti-tank weapons modernised, it is time to apply them to the Veldleger divisions.

name: Anti Aircraft Guns
description: We cannot hope to match the superpowers in terms of aerial capabilities. We must invest in a network of defensive gun emplacements and flak towers.

name: Reinforce the Vesting Holland
description: Our defences should hold, but it would be foolish of us to hope that in their current state they would prove effective enough against invading armies. Further investment into our fortifications is paramount.

name: Study Defence Plans
description: As a small coastal nation, we have always anticipated attack from the sea, but new threats on the global stage are forcing us to deal with potential land invasions as well. We need to make better plans for the defence of the Netherlands.

name: Mobilisation Preparations
description: Revisiting our mobilisation timetables and preparations will allow us to be ready for war should the need arise.

name: Korps Pioniers
description: The Pioneer Corps are the jewel in our military crown. All the same, we must invest further time and energy into them if we are to make the most advantage from their talents.

name: Prepare the Inundation Lines
description: Ever since our independence war against the Spanish in the 16th century, inundation, or intentional flooding of the land, has been an integral part of our defenses. Properly prepared, it will surely save us again: we have yet to see a tank that can cross water.

name: A Mobile Army
description: Our flat land makes mechanised and armoured divisions a no-brainer. By investing further into this area and applying new military doctrine to our army, the Netherlands can become a force to be reckoned with.

name: Bicycles For our Soldiers
description: We Dutch are famed for our bicycles. They grant the user a surprising level of mobility and have served our armies well for years. We need more. Many more.

name: Pantrado M39 Armoured Cars
description: Armoured Cars are a cheap and efficient way of scouting the battlefield and providing cheap transport for our troops. We need to extend our research into the design and production of better models.

name: Integrated Recon Battalions
description: More important than being able to fight, is knowing where your enemy is before they detect you. By integrating recon companies into our divisions, we shall give our forces a crucial edge.

name: The Gemotorizeerde Huzaren
description: While once horses were the vehicles of the cavalrymen of their day, we need new vehicles for a new breed of hussars to bring death to our enemies.

name: Requisition Civilian Trucks
description: Trucks are a vital part of an economy based on exports, but we need them to move our soldiers around!

name: Study Mobile Tactics
description: We are now starting to get all this new and expensive machinery, but we have no experience actually using them! We should study the usage of mobile truck divisions and tanks otherwise it is all for nothing.

name: Braat Overvalwagen
description: Developed in the Dutch East Indies, the Braat Overvalwagen is a cheap to make armoured personel carrier. We can consider adopting this design for the mainland army as well.

name: Pantserkorps Formation
description: The people like to see that we are spending their taxpayers' money in new fields. By publicly demonstrating our resolve to form a new armoured force, we might just be able to win some kudos.

name: The Dutch Navy
description: As we move into an era beyond the Weltkrieg, we will need to decide how our navy develops. There are multiple plans on the table, we will have to evaluate each one and decide on the best.

name: Vlootplan Helfrich
description: We simply do not possess the means to compete with Japan or any other major navy on the surface waters, hence Admiral Helfrich proposes that we outfit our navy with the ships we can also build best, submarines, and harass enemy merchantile shipping and troop transports while we protect our own!

name: Protect our Merchant Marine
description: Our merchant marine is vital to the survival of the country. Without it, we are cut off from our colonies and maritime trade with the rest of the world. Being able to escort the vulnerable cargo ships is thus critical. In order to effectively protect the convoys, we need to think about suitable ships and tactics to deploy said ships effectively.

name: Anti Submarine Destroyer
description: By far the greatest danger to our merchant fleet is not via the air, nor the few odd commerce raiders about, but hiding under water untill it might be too late to act. We thus must outfit our destroyers with the latest Anti Submarine equipment to deal with this threat.

name: Flotilla Leader
description: Large ships are expensive, and we shall never be able to build enough for our needs. It thus has been proposed to build a new class of ship, the 'flotilla leader'. Either a small cruiser or a large destroyer in size and thus comparatively cheap, packed with enough firepower to destroy enemy fast surface raiders and dangers lurking under water.

name: Requisition Civilian Cargo Ships!
description: We are at war, and we will need every ship we can muster to keep supplies flowing and moving our troops around!

name: Convoy Sailing
description: Properly organising our vulnerable transport ships with escort ships able to defend them from harm ensures they have a better chance of arriving at their destination.

name: Rotterdamsche Droogdok Maatschappij
description: The Rotterdamsche Droogdok Maatschappij has a dedicated submarine wharves which hosts talented engineers to provide us with the latest submarine designs and innovations. Furthermore, smaller surface ships can also be built at the shipyard, giving us exactly the ships we need... and can afford.

name: O Class Submarines
description: Our submarines are going to be designed mainly for operation in the Atlantic. We need them to be stealthy and hit hard to be able to compete with naval powers like Germany, the Commune of France, and the Union of Britain.

name: K Class colonial submarines
description: Our empire stretches far, so our submarines need to reach far. We thus need replacement for our aging colonial submarines, and we need more of them!

name: Ship a Day Tactics
description: Our submarines are high in quality, but low in quantity compared to other major seafaring nations. We thus must use each one at its fullest. Admiral Helfrich intends to push every submarine and crew to its limits by aggressively sailing out, and also by using unconventional tactics as diving into enemy harbours and torpedoing everything in sight.

name: Wolfpack
description: Our submarines should form small groups so they can pick of multiple targets. Should this 'wolfpack' be detected though, this could also mean that multiple submarines can not escape safely...

name: Independent Operations
description: Our submarines should always operate separately in a spread out manner. This reduces the damage potential of a successful raid, but also makes them harder to detect and might force the enemy to spread out.

name: Vlootplan Doorman
description: The navy is crucial for our survival, and we will need all the firepower we can get. Having an assortment of smaller ships and outdated cruisers will not be enough, we must invest into proper cruisers and our battleship force.

name: Wilton Fijenoord
description: The NV Dok en Werf Maatschappij Wilton-Fijenoord is located in Schiedam, west of Rotterdam. With it origins tracing back to the first half of the 19th century, and was the first Dutch shipbuilding company to use steamer turbines. It is responsible for building the majority of the Dutch cruisers, as well as some destroyers and submarines.

name: Kijkduin Class Cruisers
description: Our previous cruiser designs are either old or just outgunned and too thinly armoured. It is time the Dutch navy gets some truly modern cruisers to form the backbone of the navy.

name: A New Pantserschip
description: Our old armoured cruisers are either rusting away at the docks or converted to other uses. We can study reviving this type of ship as they can be used as capable coastal defence ships or cruiser killers, or simply as a cheaper alternative to expensive battleships.

name: Our Battleships
description: Our five Battleships were constructed during the 1920s. While we lack the knowledge to build such majestic ships from the ground up, we can refit them to improve their capabilities, or ask German ship wharfs to come up with new designs for us.

name: Capital Ship Training
description: The new large scale ships we are building will necessitate a lot of new training for the crew, and there are a lot of crew as well! We need to implement a new training regimen for all the new sailors needed by this large ocean-spanning fleet.

name: Vlootplan Furstner
description: We must radically alter our navy's composition. It is being made increasingly clear that battleships are being made redudant by the ever improving potency of the airplane. We need to expand on our existing carrier and her capabilities, and if possible acquire more naval airpower!

name: Koninklijke de Schelde
description: The area around Vlissingen is perfect for our new shipyard expansion. First built in 1875, it has traditionally focused on repair and resupply, but it's high time we made it into a large construction area as well.

name: Escort Destroyer
description: Our carrier and other capital ships are slow lumbering targets, and can easily be torpedoed if left unguarded. We need to ensure that our destroyers are up for that task.

name: Anti Aircraft Light Cruiser
description: We need ships to shoot enemy planes out of the skies to protect our fleet. A cruiser sized design is perfect for that. We can specialise our future cruiser designs to have less guns pointing at the sea, and more into the skies!

name: Carrier Tactics
description: We have a carrier force, but never properly studied how to use them effectively. We should remedy this at once.

name: The Gouden Leeuw
description: The HrMs Gouden Leeuw is truly the pride of our navy. The lone carrier gives us a massive boost in our capabilities, but other navies have more and bigger carriers than her. We can press her to the limit and try to get more planes in the hangar, or we can attempt to get a new one!

name: The Dutch Air Force
description: Airpower has already shown to be useful in the Weltkrieg, and we can only anticipate it's need increasing. We need to lay a firm foundation for airpower in the Netherlands to keep up with foreign enemies.

name: Establish the Air Academie
description: The Air Force is still lacking an organised education system for pilots and officers alike. By setting up the Luchtvaartacademie (Air Academy) we can improve the tactical operations of the air force considerably.

name: Gilze-Rijen Air Base
description: The LVA only has one proper airbase for military use, Airbase Soesterberg. Although centrally located, storing all our airplanes is not really ideal. Developing the already existing airstrip at Gilze-Rijen will give our air force an additional base.

name: Koolhoven
description: Koolhoven Vliegtuigen Fabriek N.V. situated in Rotterdam, has delivered some smaller airplane types for our air force in the past, mostly trainer planes. However, Koolhoven shows potential and we can consider giving them a chance to supply our air force with much needed modern planes.

name: Koolhoven Naval Bombers
description: Airplanes with torpedoes attached are the bane of any ship, in particular the big and lumbering ones. Koolhoven has a rough concept of a promising twin engined naval bomber design, which are perfect for patrolling near the coast for enemy shipping.

name: Carrier Plane Variants
description: The Gouden Leeuw is useless without proper planes, and she is starting to become so with her biplanes in her hanger. Koolhoven has offered us some designs which can be quickly adopted for carrier usage.

name: Koolhoven Fighters
description: As we have opted for Koolhoven as our chief designer for the air force, we should start with replacing our antiquated fighter force with new planes from Koolhoven.

name: Fokker
description: Fokker, situated in Amsterdam, has long been a dominant force in the civil aviation market. We should take the designs and adopt them for military use, lending our fighter craft extended range, agility, and firepower.

name: Fokker Fighters
description: The Fokker D.XVII forms the bulk of our fighter squadrons, and it has served well as a sturdy and agile machine. Now it is time for a replacement suitable for our needs, and who can do that better than Fokker!

name: Fokker Jachtkruisers
