description: A twin engined fighter might not be as fast and nimble, yet the proposed 'Jachtkruisers' by Fokker carry a deadly pack of machineguns, have a much longer range and can potentailly be equipped with a bomb load of their own, making them versatile planes.

name: Finish Ontwerp 115 Bomber
description: Fokker has design plans in an advanced stage for a true four engined bomber. We can order a prototype to be built and then see if we will actually build this behemoth for our air force.

name: A New Bomber
description: The LVA is in need of a new bomber as those in service are not particularly modern, or even useful. However, but we lack the capacity to have multiple types and should pick one suitable for our needs. Quick and nimble close air support planes, or continue with the Luchtkruiser two engined bomber concept?

name: Huisje-Boompje-Beestje Tactics
description: By flying very low, our relatively slow bombers are considerably harder to detect and thus have a higher chance to reach their target. Unless they hit a tree of course...

name: Luchtkruiser Tactics
description: Our twin engined planes are not just simple bombers, with their 20mm cannon installed in the nose installed they are like the cruisers of the air! They might not be fast, but an be a serious threat to other bombers, as well as enemy fighters whom decide to attack them frontally!

name: Canal in Crisis
description: With the civil war in the US, the Panama Canal is up for grabs.

name: Entente Support
description: We have aligned with the Entente. They will protect us, and we will grant them use of the Panama Canal.

name: Request Naval Technology
description: While the Canadian Navy likely isn't about to spare ships that could help in regaining the British Isles, they might be willing to share technology for us to develop our own defence fleet.

name: Encourage Entente Trade
description: It's time that we turn this into a more mutually beneficial agreement. We will encourage trade between us and the various states of the Entente.

name: We Stand Alone
description: We shall have no masters, and the Canal shall belong to us and only us.

name: Protecting Our Interests
description: We should invest in our defence forces to ensure we are prepared for foreign invasion.

name: Protecting by Air
description: We should invest in an air force.

name: Study Foreign Designs
description: We can study designs from other nations to influence our own designs.

name: Purchase Foreign Aircraft
description: We should use some of our funds to purchase foreign aircraft. We can use it for design influence and as the first planes of our air force.

name: Close Air Support Focus
description: We should gear parts of our air force towards supporting troops on the ground.

name: Logistical Improvement
description: By distributing radios and improving the way information can get from headquarters or infantry to front line bases and our pilots, our armed forces will be far more effective.

name: Fighter Interceptors
description: We should invest in designing interceptors to intercept enemy bombing before it reaches populated areas.

name: Tactical Bombing Focus
description: We should invest in medium-size bomber aircraft to bring the fight to the enemy.

name: Fighter Escorts
description: We should design our fighters to escort our own and our allies bomber aircraft.

name: All-Weather Training
description: We should train our pilots for operation in all weather conditions.

name: Our Own Aircraft
description: We should design our own aircraft to reduce our dependency on foreign manufacturing.

name: Protecting by Sea
description: We should invest in a navy to protect our interests in the Caribbean and the Pacific.

name: Protecting Trade
description: We should invest in protecting our trade from enemy attacks.

name: Convoy Hunting
description: We should invest in attacking the enemy's trade.

name: Submarine Fleet
description: We should focus our navy on submarines and their tactics.

name: Convoy Raiding Tactics
description: We should plan tactics for raiding enemy convoys while minimizing our own losses.

name: Improved Torpedo Designs
description: We should improve our torpedo designs so they are more accurate and so they have less failures.

name: Escort Fleet
description: Our fleet should consist of destroyers and cruisers and be geared towards the protection of our trade.

name: Countering Submarines
description: We need to ensure that our destroyer and cruiser crews are trained in defending our convoys from submarine attacks.

name: Designing New Cruisers
description: We need to design new cruisers geared towards protecting our convoys from surface and submarine attacks.

name: Increase Naval Production
description: We should increase our naval production to create a formidable fleet to protect our interests.

name: Create a Combined Military Academy
description: We should establish a combined army, navy, and air force academy to research new designs, plan strategies, and train officers.

name: Hold the Canal
description: We can not hold the Panama Canal without preparing defenses. We should quickly assemble defensive lines along the coast.

name: Fortify the Coast
description: We should expand our coastal fortifications to cover more than just the Canal. After all, what good is a canal if the rest of Panama is under occupation?

name: Defend our Homeland
description: We have threats on all sides, therefore we must prepare to defend our homeland to the last man.

name: Elastic Defence
description: By preparing for the inevitable fall of certian parts of the nation to a foreign invasion, we can strengthen defensive lines along natural barriers - rivers, forests, jungles, et cetera.

name: Training the Masses
description: We should instruct each and every civilian in the use of our weapons and use them as an emergency reserve to call from at any time.

name: Every Man a Rifle
description: We should equip all of our civilians with older rifles, so that way if we call upon them they are prepared to do their duty to protect Panama.

name: Increase Recruitment
description: We should strengthen our recruitment campaigns and encourage more people to join the defence of our great nation.

name: New Weaponry
description: We should invest heavily in the weapons industry so we can improve the equipment of our troops.

name: Static Defence
description: We shall not give an inch of ground to foreign invaders!

name: Purchase Foreign Guns
description: Our domestic arms industry is weak at the moment. We should purchase foreign guns and use them to equip our forces.

name: Invest in Support Artillery
description: We should invest in acquiring the infrastructure to produce artillery pieces to support our armies.

name: Mobilize Economy
description: We must ensure that the civilian economy stands beside us when we go to war.

name: Propaganda Campaign
description: We should begin distributing posters to cities highlighting reasons to join the armed forces and defend the country.

name: Invest in Industry
description: We should invest in our factories greatly to create jobs and modernize our nation.

name: Build New Factories
description: Building new factories creates jobs in both the short term and the long term, and improves our production capacity.

name: Military Production
description: We should build military factories so we can produce new weapons for the armed forces.

name: Drill for Oil
description: Panama has vast natural resources. It's just a matter of finding and extracting them.

name: An Industrialized Panama
description: We have fully industrialized Panama, and it's starting to show. The economy is booming, unemployment is down, and Panama is turning into a truly modern nation.

name: Improved Roads
description: We should improve our infrastructure to fit modern vehicles.

name: Aerial Infrastructure
description: We should invest heavily in creating airfields for our air force and for civilian airlines.

name: Widespread Economic Growth
description: Our economy is expanding very nicely.

name: Improve Agriculture
description: By investing in our already agrarian society, we can create more goods for export and expand jobs.

name: Domestic Farms
description: By clearing land to make new farms, we can export more goods and earn more money.

name: Countering Panama Disease
description: Panama Disease has been ruining our banana farmers for years now, with focus on agriculture we must help our fellow men and wipe this problem once and for all.

name: Purchasing Foreign Assets
description: Using our new funds from exporting, we should purchase some of the foreign-owned businesses and farms.

name: An Agrarian Panama
description: We have modernized our agrarian ways, and our economy is booming thanks to the crop exports.

name: Improve Sugar Farms
description: We should invest in our sugar farms specifically, to increase the yield and encourage efficient harvesting.

name: Increase Banana Exports
description: By increasing our banana exports, both the farmers and we can earn far more money.

name: Encourage Coffee Production
description: We should encourage the production of coffee among our farms, both for the populace and for export.

name: Found the University of Panama
description: We should create a state institution of education that will help teach the youth of Panama specialized fields such as commerce, engineering, law, and sciences.

name: Panama on the Global Stage
description: We should open up the nation to foreign trade and investments.

name: Protests Succeed
description: After weeks of unrest, the Americans have finally decided to take action. It is now up to the Governor and the political forces behind Puerto Rico to either reach an agreement or pave the way for a much longed independence...

name: Puerto Rican National Defence
description: As an independent nation, Puerto Rico will still need an army, one that can guard its borders and defend its interests abroad. While we have a head start thank to Esteves' National Guard, we still need to advance such an organization into a full new institution, a Puerto Rican Army

name: Puerto Rican Coast Guard
description: As an island nation, the control of our shores is paramount for our national security. While creating a fleet is a long term project, it is one we would be wise to invest in.

name: Economic Recovery Plan
description: After more than a decade of economic hardship, several plans and schemes have been drafted to help us out of the Depression. While back in their time the Americans failed to implement them now that we're carving up our own destiny, it may be time to restart these plans and get the Puerto Rican Economy back on track.

name: San Juan Convention
description: Governor Winship has decided that the best way to tackle the anti American sentiment in the island is to convene with the different parties that represent the Puerto Rican People in the Legislature in order to reach a compromise. Whether this will save the American presence on the island or further doom it, remains to be seen...

name: Destroyer Projects
description: Destroyers are vital for any modern day navy, no matter its size. These light escort ships protect vital trade routes from vicious submarine attacks, and if Puerto Rico's trade is going to be secure, we should look forward to developing them.

name: Import Submarine Designs
description: While Destroyers are vital for protecting our trade routes, our enemies also have their trade routes, and considering our limited resources, we cannot afford their trade to reach their shores or else we'll lose in the long run. We should invest in Submarines in order to have the means to disrupt said trade routes.

name: Founding the Astillero de Puerto Rico
description: For years, a proposal had been thrown around about creating a Puerto Rican Dockyard in San Juan, one that would help with the unemployment in the area as well as providing a badly needed replacement to American trade shipping, which had a monopoly on the island until very recently. Now, we're finally ready to invest and create the Astillero de Puerto.

name: Negotiations Fail
description: Despite the Governor's best attempts, there was no compromise to be found with the Union of Puerto Rico. Now the only option left is to ensure a peaceful transition towards independence.

name: Copy the American Model
description: The Americans have protected the island for over three decades, and many of our current officers served in the American system. It is only logical that, instead of changing our structure,we stick to the devil we know and continue utilizing and expanding upon the American system.

name: Aggressive Autarky
description: As foreign investors pull out their funding, or an economic recession hits the world, hundreds of thousands in Puerto Rico become unemployed overnight, and such a situation has become unsustainable over the years. The Nationalists have long advocated for strong protectionist measures and so, we shall start implementing these new policies to get the Puerto Rican Economy back on track once more.

name: Negotiations Successful
description: Having managed to bring the UPR members around, we have been able to sign an agreement, and we are on our way to returning to the Union as allies once more.

name: Puerto Rico Relief Plan
description: One of the points of the San Juan Convention was the dire need for economic relief for Puerto Rico, as the island's economy lays in ruin due to decades of an agricultural export oriented model. The American Government will need to pool its resources in order to provide work for Puerto Ricans, but it'll be beneficial for both of us in the long run.

name: Economic Stance Towards the Union
description: Even if our push for independence is genuine, we cannot fully cut our ties with the American Government. We need to establish the status of the American business and trade in regards to Puerto Rico, and while this may end poorly with the American government, it'd be beneficial that we settle an agreement as soon as possible.

name: Status of American Citizens
description: While Americans have guaranteed they won't impede our self-determination, it's clear that they have a vested interest in the continued well-being of Americans on the island. Approaching them with a treaty to ease tensions could definitely go a long way into ensuring they see us more positively.

name: Status of Puerto Ricans in America
description: Despite the passing of the Jones Act, Puerto Ricans in America have been long treated as second class citizens, being given little recognition in terms of civil rights, as they literally couldn't vote until very recently, and even forcing some Puerto Ricans to serve on segregated African-American Regiments! This will need to change if our island is to integrate back into the Union

name: Back to the Union
description: With our population supporting our return to the Union, we should finally rejoin the Americans and fight together as one once more!

name: Declare Full Independence
description: With our agreements with the Americans signed, it's finally time for us to sign a definitive declaration of independence. Copying our South American cousins, we'll make a formal declaration that'll make our founding fathers proud and then archive it for future generations.

name: Home Grown Defence Force
description: With the expulsion of the American-trained staff, why should we keep their oppressive institutions? We have long had a parallel organizations, like the Cadets of the Republic, which has acted as an informal fighting force for the island for years. Perhaps we should adopt their structure, and expand on them as our new army, as opposed to simply copying what the Americans tried to impose on us.

name: Recruitment Drive
description: One of the main necessities of the Cadets is raw recruits. As its structure is more built around strength in numbers, it has a constant need for fresh recruits, and as such, we should both encourage people to join the organization willingly, as well as draft able bodied men into a separate reserve to call them upon our time of need.

name: Create Weapon's Workshops
description: Lacking an arms industry and any willing foreign suppliers, we have no choice but to rely on ourselves for our own weapons production. While it may be difficult to set up, it'll be beneficial for us in the long run that we import tooling to make weapons and begin the first weapon's workshops of the island.

name: Weapons' Contractors
description: With contacts in America, we have been able to secure a solid weapons contract for our military needs. While some argued that a local production would've been better, there's no denying that it's better to have foreign tried and true weapons than risk producing subpar material here on our island.

name: Puerto Rican National Guard
description: The Puerto Rican National Guard, created in June 3 of 1916, has been of vital importance when it came to the defence of the island since its inception. Its founder and Commander-in-Chief,Luis R. Esteves, has suggested that we expand upon it as our main combat force, as it's the both the most well developed and trained defence institution in our nation, and so we shall indulge his request.

name: Officer Exchange Program
description: West Point has long since taken Puerto Rican recruits for officer training. However, with Puerto Rico establishing itself as an independent nation, this arrangement sees itself threatened. Luckily, Commander Esteves has contacts on the Academy that indicate that they're willing to continue taking recruits provided we reach an economically viable arrangement for it.

name: Puerto Rican Patrol Air Force
description: While the Air Force has never really been a part of the Cadets priorities, it's clear that our force alone won't hold against a foreign naval invasion. We need planes capable of preventing naval landings, not to fully repel an invasion but to at least weak it enough for our land forces to take care of them, so we should therefore invest in an air force capable of providing us with said protection.

name: Puerto Rico Air National Guard
description: Following the American example yet again, Puerto Rico should begin building an equivalent of the United States Army Air Corps. Focusing on protecting our skies as well as coordinating with our armies, it should help our infantry have an edge on the battlefield.

name: Naval Bomber Protection
description: As Per our plan, the import and creation of Naval Bombers is a priority so that we may create a perimeter around our island where our enemies can't attack us, focusing their efforts on key areas where our local forces can intercept them.

name: Re-purpose Castle San Felipe del Morro
description: Castle San Felipe has long since stood as a symbol of our national defence, and provided it's strategic position and ample training grounds, it has been proposed as a place to set up an officer academy for the Cadets of the Republic to train. We should allow the plan to go forward and fund its progress.

name: The New Army Marches Forward
description: With our Army reforms at an end, the Puerto Rican military can now stand shoulder to shoulder with any force in the Caribbean!

name: Puerto Rican Trade Connections
description: Regardless of whatever economic plans our government undertakes, we will need to sustain trade with other nations on our own shoulders. It would be in our government's best interest in invest in convoy ships, so we can solidify the stability of our economy via trade.

name: Naval Officer Initiative
description: A lack of Naval Officers has affected our nation since our newly-found independence. By funding the creation of a small naval academy in the San Juan port as well as paying for our graduates to study abroad and return to our service, we will be able to overcome this shortcoming.

name: Coastal Patrol Force
description: With the consolidation of our Air Branch, we can finally field a combat capable coastal patrol force, that will both serve as scouts to warn us of enemy activity as well as our first means of defense against an attack.

name: Fleet Exercises
description: While the newly founded Puerto Rican Navy will definitely never reach the same size as the German or American fleets, we still need a combat worthy force! For that, a series of exercises shall be conducted off our shores to ensure our forces are up for the task.

name: Found a new Officer's Academy
description: Without the option of sending our officers abroad, due to both diplomatic and monetary reasons, we are forced to open our own officer academy in San Juan. While not very impressive when compared to places like the Annapolis Naval Academy, it'll still get the job done for our small navy in providing a steady stream of capable officers.

name: Fighter Investments
description: Any form of Puerto Rican Air Force would be in dire need of Fighters! As such, it is our duty to supply our pilots with the equipment necessary to achieve air superiority.

name: Medium Bomber Investments
description: While small and nimble naval bombers can certainly pack quite a punch against enemy ships, there are also times where the enemy will land, and we will need something to harass their troops on land, as well as planes that can withstand heavier damage in order to reach more valuable naval targets. As such, we should invest in Medium Bombers

name: Close Air Support Effort
description: Close Air Support planes are a new wonder of the battlefield. While not carrying as much ordinance as heavy bombers, they compensate this shortcoming with accuracy, and such accuracy is a thing we will need in case our island becomes threatened once more, as we cannot afford the collateral damage or the waste of resources. Therefore, we should invest further into acquiring and developing this type of aircraft.

name: Protecting Puerto Rico's Skies
description: While we may have planes at our disposition, that's not enough to protect our cities from bombings and to secure air superiority. We need to hire instructors to teach our pilots how to best take advantage of their own planes and of the enemy.

name: Export Focused Economy
description: Despite protests from the Nationalists, we have no real choice economically but to sustain the agricultural export model. While this means that, for now, we will continue exporting, we will still focus a part of our proceeds into our local industry, even if it may slow down our industrial development in the long run.

name: Improving the Sugar Market
description: The sugar plantations in the island have long since been the backbone of the Puerto Rican economy. However, they have largely grown outdated, and with our whole economy dependant on them, it will require some serious effort to modernize this sector if we truly wish to survive our economic depression.

name: Securing Pineapple Investments
description: The Pineapple market is an often overlooked sector for many agriculture-oriented economies, largely due to the exceptional conditions required to cultivate it. Luckily for us, Pineapples are easy to come by on our island, and a great source of revenue from a rather unexploited market, so we should secure some investments into this fast growing agricultural sector!

name: Subsistence Farming
description: Our farmers have been forced for ages to cultivate cash crops in order to survive. However, with our shift in economic policy to a more autarkic model, these same farmers are now suffering from shortages due to them being unable to sell most of their sugar now. As a solution, subsistence farming shall be encouraged so that our farmers may become independent once more from export profits.

name: Industrial Investments
description: While Puerto Rico may enforce harsh tariffs for its exports, there's no denying that there's a patent lack of money to make industrial investments. As such, we shall provide tax reliefs and special settlement clauses for new companies to arrive at our island and provide some much needed work to our citizens.

name: Import Industrial Tooling
description: Regardless of our approach to economic policy, the existing Puerto Rican light industry is in dire need of modernization. Importation of modern tools and industrial machinery should get us up to speed with other nations of the world.

name: Pass Government Relief Plans
description: The major bane of the Puerto Rican economy is large amounts of unemployment. Considering the lack of natural ways for people to acquire work, there are few options other than creating jobs via investment and publicly owned companies. As such, we should seek to kick-start a government funded construction company in San Juan so that it may help alleviate our unemployment issue.

name: Economic Crisis Resolved
description: While the aftershocks of the recession will likely affect our nation for the years if not decades to come, the worst of it is now over. While this may not yet mark the end of all of Puerto Rico's woes, it's certainly a step in the right direction.

name: Investment in Light Industry
description: Light Industry has been vital to facilitate exports of sugar from our plantations. By further investing in it, we will be able to enhance our sugar output and yield even greater profits from our exports program.

name: Assembly Line Production
description: As our nation industrializes, we also need to adapt our industrial methodology. Considering the rampant unemployment on the island, it'd be in our best interest to adopt an assembly line production system that employs as many workers as possible for as many tasks as required, and so we shall encourage this practice in our existing industry.

name: The Hour of Nationalism
description: With the people finally throwing away the shackles of their foreign oppressors, now is the time for the Nationalist Party to come to the forefront as the confrontation they had been preparing for nearly a decade ensues. We will prevail, by any means necessary!

name: The Second Grito de Lares
description: With our foreign oppressors now coming back to put their shackles back on us, we need to rally our people once more. The most well known rebellion on our island was the 1868 Grito de Lares, and in order to rally our people, we should embrace the idea that this is the Second Grito de Lares, the one where Puerto Rico will finally be free!

name: Form Popular Militias
description: There's no time to wait for Esteves' National Guard to mobilize. We need every man we can get and as such, we should start mobilizing every man and woman that wishes to see Puerto Rico be independent from foreign invaders.

name: The Revolution Successful
description: One way or another, our new government has survived against all odds. Now, we need to look forward to rebuilding and remaking Puerto Rico from scratch.

name: Refit Castle San Felipe del Morro
description: Castle San Felipe del Morro has long stood as one of the major defensive fortification of the island. While vastly outdated, there are ways we can improvise its construction and strategical position to turn it into a fortification that can effectively defend San Juan from foreign invaders.

name: Naval Invasion Defences
description: The refitting of the castle is not enough to secure the entire island. We require trenches, bunkers, sea walls, anything and everything that may help us repel or at the very least slow down the invaders.

name: Weapons Smuggling
description: Given our lack of local industry, we have no option but to secure weapons through 'unconventional' means. Some Cuban smugglers have contacted us to sneak rifles into our island, but they'll obviously not do this for free...

name: Recruitment Efforts
description: The militias we raised are important, but not quite enough. We need every hand on deck for the coming battles, and we should try and encourage the recruitment of every able bodied men from the island to at least auxiliary roles.

name: Guerilla Warfare Tactics
description: The Cadets of the Republic have long since taken up arms in the forests and jungles of the island, preparing for the time they'd need to fight the Americans. Now, their expertise is direly needed for our struggle, and thankfully, they have a thing or two to teach to our new recruits.

name: Improvised Anti Air Batteries
description: While we may control the land on our island, the enemy has certain control of the skies. We need to create a division in our militias that keeps watch of the skies and dedicates itself to taking down enemy planes as they appear. We may not have much, but perhaps we can re-purpose some of the machine guns the Americans left behind for this task.

name: For a Free Puerto Rico!
description: With our defences ready, our army prepared and the enemies at our gates, it should be every citizen's duty to make sure we succeed. Sacrifices may have to be made, rationing will have to be done, but victory wasn't meant to be easy. Regardless, we need to march forward if we wish to save our nation from another century of colonialism, onwards!

name: Fate of the Democrats
description: While democratic parties like the Liberals were supportive of our revolt, others like the Republicans or Socialists were opposed to our revolution. Luckily, we don't need to deal with their attempts at weakening our government any further, so it shall be up to our leader to decide whether or not we should keep a façade of legitimacy by supporting these parties, or if we should just cut them off for good.

name: The New Puerto Rican Government
description: With Albizu now comfortably sitting in La Fortaleza, the Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico must convene to decide on the new government. However, all may not be as good as it looks, and cracks are beginning to form within the party...

name: Towards a New Puerto Rico
description: Albizu has grand plans to remaking Puerto Rico from the ground up. Now that we have fully released ourselves from the shackles of European and American Imperialism, there's no better time than to start remaking our society, from its political sphere, to its economic sphere as well as its social sphere. A series of reforms will begin soon enough that will shape the fate of our nation for the years to come!

name: Deal with the Remaining Americans
description: Americans have long been a plague in the island and we're finally in a position to deliver a killing blow to their presence here for good. However, not everyone agrees that we should do this in the party, and it falls to Albizu to resolve this disagreement...

name: Economic Reform Program
description: Despite years of attempted economic reform, none of the American policies managed to truly help the common Puerto Rican. As such, it falls to the Nationalist party to ensure a better livelihood for all Puerto Ricans, but as for what that entails, it remains to be discussed by the party...

name: Political Reform Campaign
description: For decades, Puerto Ricans have existed isolated from political activity. It was only during very short and very restricted periods where our people actually enjoyed the right of voting, and this has all been due to the permeating influence of foreign oppressors. Luckily, the Nationalist Party may yet have a cure for such a disease...

name: Social Reform Plan
description: While our culture has endured despite attempts of cultural colonization by the Americans, there is still work to be done towards consolidating it. As such, the party has drafted a plan to solidify some of the concepts Albizu has denominated as 'Puerto Rican', but it'll be up to him whether he truly wants his concept of Puerto Rican identity to be mandatory or only something for true Patriots...

name: International Recognition
description: With our revolt having been less than legal, and highly violent, the international community originally shunned us and refused to acknowledge our existence, largely to toe the line to their Anglo-Saxon masters! However, a long time has passed since then, and it may now be time to finally reach out with the rest of the world in a search for recognition.

name: The Antillean Dream
description: The idea of a United Antillean state was proposed by one of Puerto Rico's founding fathers, Ramón Emeterio Betances. Considering that such a union would also afford us protection from further aggression, it could be a positive geopolitical move, especially now that there are no Spaniards or Americans to defend us.

name: A Truly Independent Puerto Rico
description: We need no rulers or masters to guide our path. Puerto Rico is perfectly fine as its own thing in the Caribbean, and our only search should be for someone who wishes us to remain this way, as opposed to trying to secure any long dead dream of grandeur our founding fathers may have had.

name: Economic Integration
description: One of the big obstacles to an Antillean union is the heterogeneous nature of the Cuban, Dominican and Puerto Rican economy. This will require a multinational co-operation effort, but it will ease up the unification process once it is complete.

name: Political Integration
description: Another of the big obstacles to the Antillean union is the large, almost irreconcilable differences regarding to the internal workings of the politics on each of its members. We will have to unify the offices and ministries of a lot of sectors if we wish to reach a cohesive unit of a government as the alternative would be an ineffective government that'd very much have people desire we never unified in the first place.

name: Antilles United Once More
description: After a long road of negotiations, integrations and reforms, the time is finally right to found the Antillean Union. Long live our friends in Cuba and the Dominican Republic! May the dream of Ramón Emeterio Betances live for as long as our nations stand tall!

name: Seek a New Protector
description: Puerto Rico has always counted with a larger nation to protect it from outside aggression. First it was Spain, then it was the Americans, but now, with both fully gone from the island, we need to find a new protector.

name: Old Friendships
description: The Venezuelan government and people had been receptive of Albizu's speeches and campaigns since the start. Given their proximity and their relative power projection, perhaps it would be wise to close ties with them once more, and take advantage of our diplomatic affinity for our protection.

name: Constitutional Convention
description: Our first move as an independent nation should be to draft a constitution. While not every nation has or needs a constitution, it'll help solidify the legitimacy of our government over the people of Puerto Rico in the eyes of the international community, as well as allowing us to establish a set of baseline rules all parties have to follow from now on.

name: First Election of Puerto Rico
description: Discounting the Legislative elections that were held every four years after the Jones Act, now is the first time in decades that the Puerto Rican people have been able to vote on their representatives. While excitement over this historical event is nearly palpable, there are still worries abroad that a radical party being elected can potentially throw the careful co-existence of parties in the island off course...

name: International Recognition
description: While our declaration of Independence having been a rather peaceful affair has solidified our position in the international stage, we still need to re-establish formal relations with countries that could and should recognize us as a sovereign nation. As such, we should dispatch delegates as soon as possible to negotiate with other nations in order to establish new embassies abroad.

name: Partido Union Elected
description: The Partido Union, founded in 1932 by Jose Cull y Cuchi after deserting from the nationalist party, is an oddity of the Puerto Rican political scene. While strictly a protectionist party, similar to the PNPR, it has picked up some of the rhetoric of the America First Party, to the point its leader is openly compared to Huey Long! and as the election seems to suggest, maybe that's just what Puerto Rico wants right now...

name: Partido Nacionalista Victorious
description: While not an underdog by any stretch, the Nationalist victory still comes as a surprise for many who saw the party as a temporal entity, one that was meant to exist to seek a violent independence from foreigners as opposed to one running a democratically elected office. Nevertheless, Albizu has clearly come ahead in the voting booths, and shall now be President of Puerto Rico.

name: Partido Liberal Successful
description: With Barceló now as the acting president, many expect that the Puerto Rican instability that has disrupted the island for nearly a decade finally comes to an end, as the Liberals had promised. Whether they'll be able to deliver or not, remains to be seen...

name: Partido Socialista Triumphant
description: An underdog in the election, the Partido Socialista has managed to win against all odds. Now, it falls to aging Santiago Iglesias Pantín to lead Puerto Rico for the next four years, and hopefully bring a semblance of stability and progress that has for so long eluded the island.

name: Operación Serenidad
description: One of the main issues that the President has stated from the Puerto Rican society is that culturally, it's not yet prepared to embrace a modern industrial lifestyle. To fix this, he has proposed a bill that has come to be known by the press as Operación Serenidad, with the intent of passing an education reform where the government will enshrine industrial values and respect for other market-oriented nations.

name: Land Reform
description: With long-time dominance by Spanish and American colonialism, the land of Puerto Rico has been generally dominated by the sugar industry. In order to fix this, we must begin to redistribute the land from big sugar to the people of Puerto Rico. We will no longer be simply, as the Americans have described us, "a mountain range entirely surrounded by sugar cane", but a country of the people.

name: Nationalist Reform Program
description: While the Nationalists have managed to be elected, they have done so with a minority of the votes, forcing it to ally with the Union Party. This means that, while the Nationalists have brought an extremely ambitious reform program to the table, it's likely that it'll come out on the other side in a very different version that what they had originally intended to pass...

name: Share the Wealth
description: The Union Party has been built to closely reassemble the America First Party in the United States, and as such, has picked up on the Share the Wealth Program and its intricacies. Now, the President has proposed a bill in the Puerto Rican Congress so that the dream of a Puerto Rican share the wealth program actually becomes a reality. Whether this plan will be a success or utter failure, remains to be seen...

name: Anti-American Sentiment
description: Despite the Americans fully abandoning the island legally speaking by now, there is no denying that many within our people are more than resentful to them. We can channel that resentment to push forward legislation that'd be otherwise considered controversial, and hopefully be able to expropriate American landowners in favour of Puerto Rican ones without having too much political backlash.

name: Solidify Belief in Democracy
description: Puerto Rico had started to lose faith in democracy when the 1932 legislative election yielded the victory of Pro-American parties, with significant groups of the Puerto Rican electorate outright refusing to vote from there on. With our independence, this apathy to our system of governance should not be allowed, and we should start a nation wide propaganda campaign to spread the benefits of democracy to the people.

name: Shining Jewel of the Caribbean
description: As our government's reforms are completed and we march forward, there's a sense of national unity and progress that had left the island since the Spanish-American War. For the first time, Puerto Ricans can now participate openly in politics, and choose their own destiny, and that is slowly turning our small island into a shining beacon of peace and stability for our neighbours to see.

name: The Puerto Rican Fair Deal
description: Having seen first hand the policies the Republicans have proposed in America, the Liberal leadership has had plans of passing a similar program in the island. Now, with their election into power, it's time for this idea to leave the drawing board and finally reach congress, and later, the Puerto Rican people.

name: Puerto Rican Autarky
description: The Union Party has proposed a slightly less aggressive plan of autarky than the Nationalists. While sugar exporters rejoice, there's no denying that tough times are coming until we can fully industrialize the island, but Jose Coll y Cuchi has stated that this will be a small sacrifice today for the rewards we will get tomorrow.

name: Direct Economic Control
description: The PNPR has argued that our government should take full control of Economic Exports in our nation, and with the support of the Union party, it seems likely that they'll get their way. While cash crop producers bemoan the bill introduced by Albizu, others point out, perhaps rightly, that this can possibly change the island for the better.

name: Labour Friendly Laws
description: The labour movement in Puerto Rico is small, but not negligible. The Liberal party has long since tried to reach agreements with them but so far, they had chosen to toe the line to the Americans in exchange for investments. Now, however, with us in power, we can offer them new agreements and mediate some labour disputes in their favour to further solidify our position as Puerto Rico's most popular party.

name: Operación Manos a La Obra
description: The island's greatest woe is its lack of industrialization, which has left a great part of our population unemployed. However, there's still hope for us. The President has come into congress with an extremely ambitious plan, dubbed by the press as Operation Manos a la Obra. In it, he intends to push our economy to the limit in order to reach a new standard of industrialization.

name: Chengdu-Chongqing Railway
description: Most of Sichuan still relies on the same dirt trails that have been in use since the early Imperial era. We can't have a modern economy without modern infrastructure. By connecting our most vital cities with a modern railway line we'll create the foundation for Sichuan's new industries.

name: New Commercial Zones
description: The state alone cannot bring prosperity to its people. By designating certain parts of Sichuan as special commercial zones with attractive prices, we'll be able to attract investments from other parts of China as well as abroad.

name: The Yangtze Lifeline
description: Being a landlocked country, we conduct most of our trade along the Yangtze River and rely on merchant vessels to reach the rest of China and beyond. By partnering with a reliable manufacturer, we can make sure that we have enough ships to expand our trade along the river.

name: Restart the Agricultural Sector
description: Our agriculture was hit hardest in the civil war and the subsequent drought which has left it a shadow of its former self. A major program of repairs to the Dujiangyan systems and farm reconstruction is needed if we're going to recover. It'll be the first step on the road to turning the Sichuan basin into the bread basket of China.

name: Rural Construction College
description: The heavy focus on our industrial heartland has left the rural regions behind with many countryside communities looking like they did in the dynasties of old. With so much untapped potential, it'd be a waste not to bring in the wonders of modern engineering to improve the lives - and productivity - of our farmers.

name: Rice and Wheat Improvement Station
description: Outdated farming techniques causes us a significant amount of wasted output across our agricultural sector. Modernizing how we process our crops will greatly improve both the yields and the quality of what our farms produce annually, which should go a long way in preventing any future shortages.

name: Expand the Dujiangyan Irrigation System
description: Repairing Dujiangyan sufficed at first, but with our increased output and wealth it's high time we modernized and expanded it. With the skill and knowledge provided by the Rural Construction College, we'll turn these ancient channels once again into the crown jewel of agriculture along the Yangtze!

name: Industrial Silk
description: Industrialization has seen massive improvements both for the quality and quantity of the textile industry, yet the fruits of these developments have yet to see widespread adoption in our factories and workshops. It's high time that we started to adopt industrial silk production techniques on a large scale.

name: Tianfu Mining Bureau
description: By investing into expanding our current mining sector, we'll be able to reach more of Sichuan's riches. This will be vital not only for strengthening our economy, but will help us remain independent of foreign imports as well.

name: Zigong Saltworks
description: Salt has been an important cornerstone of Sichuanese economy since ancient times. While no longer the backbone it used to be in our industrialized economy, by expanding and modernizing our salt mines we'll make sure it remains a profitable venture for us in the future as well.

name: Extract Natural Gas
description: Sichuan sits upon the largest natural gas reserve in China, but a lot of it remains untapped. We ought to invest in this sector so that these riches don't go to waste.

name: Jialing Coal Fields
description: Our predominantly fueled by by coal. It keeps the lights on in our factories and it keeps our people warm. We must make sure that our coal production can keep pace with our demand for energy.

name: Industrial Planning Committee
description: Before we launch any major industrialization programs we need to set up a committee to assess our available resources after the civil war and plan the best approach for our future expansions. While it'll considerably expand the bureaucratic apparatus, the increased efficiency will pay dividends in the end.

name: Import Foreign Machinery
description: With both our industrial hubs of Chongqing and Chengdu badly battered by the war, we'll need to import equipment from abroad in order to get our industry back on its feet again. The planning committee has already laid out a budget for this and they only await our approval.

name: Modern Construction Technology
description: The Industrial Planning Committee has reached the conclusion that there's no way around the fact that our construction methods, tools and even basic know-how are all outdated. By bringing in more equipment and advisers to Sichuan, we'll be able to refine our construction methods.

name: Study Production Innovations
description: It's one thing to have access to advanced machinery, but if we are to be able to match the production methods of the Europeans and Japanese with our own, we need to study their respective approaches and apply what we learn to our own manufacturing techniques. As always, the IPC has budgeted for the associated costs.

name: Urban Modernisation and Sanitation
description: With our industry's rapid growth and the early successes of our urbanization program, the next step is to bring the great cities of Sichuan into the twentieth century by modernizing their infrastructure to modern standards. It'll greatly improve living standards for the inhabitants and allow us to expand them further.

name: Western China Academy of Sciences
description: An important part of our modernization plan is to make Sichuan a landmark for higher education in China. By establishing the Western China Academy of Sciences, we'll be able to better educate our citizens and attract some of the brightest minds in China to our country.

name: Increase Steel Production
description: Many of Sichuan's steel mills and ore mines use techniques and tools from the last century and sometimes these methods even more backwards and outdated to the point where they endanger our laborers. Bringing these methods into the current century will turn Chongqing into the beating heart of Chinese steel production.

name: Rebuild the Chengdu Machine Bureau
description: Underutilised before the war and damaged during it, the Chengdu Machine Bureau has great potential thanks to previous investments into its infrastructure. We'll rebuild it and make it a cornerstone of Chengdu's industrialization process.

name: Huaxi Machinery Factory
description: With the rapid industrialization efforts that we have planned, the ways of old are ceding ground as we utilize more and more machine tools and vehicles. In order to keep up with demand, our planners have proposed establishing industries in the Huaxi district, turning it into a model for industrialization.

name: Textile Production
description: Chinese textiles are known far and wide for their quality and unique style. Sichuan has always had a large role in this trade and with both the increased demand for these goods and the relative safety of the basin these days, it'd be a good investment to deepen our role in this trade.

name: Xikang Hydropower
description: For the time being, most of Sichuan's energy needs comes from the use of coal power and natural gas. Our engineers tell us, however, that there's vast amounts of untapped energy in the mountainous west, offering numerous opportunities for the construction of hydro electric dams. This should allow our energy needs to keep pace with our growing industrialization.

name: Electrification Efforts
description: Leave the confines of Chengdu and Chongqing and much of Sichuan is lit by candles and oil at night. With our energy generation efforts bearing fruits, however, we can finally bring electricity out to the countryside. Electricity will keep the countryside bright at night, our people warm in the winter and make our factories even more productive.

name: Modernised Manufacturing
description: Our efforts that began with the reconstruction after the civil war have blossomed and helped turn Sichuan's basin into a small, if growing, industrial heartland. We can soon boast having some of the best industrial partners in all of China and reap even more rewards from our toil and hard work.

name: The Arsenal Programme
description: Chongqing has long boasted some capable military industry, with the Chongqing Arsenal being the biggest among them. The Industrial Planning Committee has proposed an expansion of the arsenal using the techniques and equipment they've acquired, allowing us to maintain our military production edge in the region.

name: Expand Production: Artillery
description: Sichuan is home to some of the most effective small arms production in China, but there's still room for improvement when it comes to heavier ordinance. Just like the Chongqing arsenal is known across China for its effective rifles, the Heijang Artillery Arsenal will bring modern artillery production methods to Sichuan.

name: Expand Production: Tanks
description: Tanks have proven their worth in the Weltkrieg and subsequent conflicts thanks to their ability to break through enemy defenses. With our growing industrial base, we're finally in a position to start small-scale production of tanks that will help us dominate the Asian battlefields.

name: Expand Production: Aircraft
description: Often neglected by Chinese military planners, aircraft are becoming an indispensable part of any modern military. Because of Sichuan's mountainous geography, catching up here could be vital for future conflicts where planes will provide eyes in the sky for our troops and artillery and rain death from above upon our enemies.

name: Rebuild the Sichuanese Army
description: The current state of Sichuan's army leaves a lot to be desired. It's an outdated and splintered body lacking in cohesion. Our first step will be to bring the army together from its fractured background so that our soldiers can fight more effectively for their homeland.

name: Rebuild the Officer Corps
description: Fractured between many different factions, it's an unfortunate fact that our army's leadership is splintered and lacks a unified sense of strategy. By establishing our own Sichuanese military academy we can start instilling a proper understanding of modern warfare into our commanders.

name: New Infantry Weapons
description: Even by the standards of the rest of China, our army lags behind in many areas. It's time we started to combat this by taking steps to modernize our infantry divisions and give our soldiers the equipment they need to defend Sichuan.

name: Import Modern Artillery
description: As it stands, many of our artillery detachment use the same guns that they fielded in the conflicts of the past decades. This won't stand. Importing foreign artillery pieces and know-how would help us a great deal in mitigating this issue.

name: Recon Unit Training
description: Most of Sichuan's terrain is harsh with high mountains and mighty rivers covering most of our lands. Knowledge of the terrain can mean the difference between life and death.  Let's make sure we're on the favorable side in that equation.

name: Mountain Warfare
description: What our army may lack in modern equipment can easily be made up for by using terrain to our advantage. With most of Sichuan and her neighbors being covered in rugged mountains, a company trained to fight among them can often be worth more than a division of regular soldiers.

name: Adopt the Southern Doctrine
description: We should not blindly modernize for the sake of modernization. Our resources make it more prudent to adopt the Southern Doctrine instead and focus on what the Europeans call unconventional tactics but fit the Chinese hand like a glove. Whether it's large-front assaults or guerrilla warfare, we'll master at it.

name: War Logistics
description: Fielding a larger army means that we have a bigger supply chain to maintain. By creating a specialized department of logistics and assigning some of our more qualified officers to oversee it, we'll ensure that our troops stay supplied while minimizing corruption and waste along the way.

name: Asymetric Warfare
description: At the present it's unrealistic for us to try and match countries like Japan in terms of massed tanks, air power and artillery. Instead we should negate their advantages using our own cunning and encouraging our officers to rely of tactics that let their agile forces choose the terms of the battle, not the rigidly structured foe they face.

name: Heavy Fire Tactics
description: By training our officers and soldiers to detect weak points in the enemy's lines and quickly exploit them with overwhelming force, we can achieve breakthroughs more easily.

name: Increase Munitions Production
description: Our production of munitions need to keep pace with our increased use of heavy guns in the field. By investing into further optimizing our production lines for shells and other munitions we will be able to keep up the pace and allow our front line officers to relentlessly bombard our enemies without any fears of shortages.

name: Continue the Northern Doctrine
description: What we lack in modern equipment we shall make up for by being adaptable, quick and resourceful. With speed and perseverance we will outmaneuver our enemies, be it through our officers cunning and initiative or our troops peerless ability to march and fight across great distances.

name: Focus on Speed
description: We'll train our troops in path-finding and invest in equipment like improved boots and tires to fine-tune our army's performance. By doing this, we're sure to dictate the terms of battle and where it's fought!

name: Improved Army Training
description: An army of untrained soldiers is hardly more effective than a mob of bandits. Although our efforts to improve the training of both our soldiers and officers have been substantial, there's still room for more refinement. We don't just want a good army - we should aim to have the most professional one in all of China.

name: Anti-Tank Preparations
description: Tall mountains, deep valleys and wide rivers. Nearly every inch of our land is a potential death trap for enemy tank crews and we'll make sure that our soldiers make the most of this fact.

name: Study Tank Designs
description: The tank has proven to be a key component in the modern battlefield. We cannot afford to lag behind in this development and must study the tank designs of Germany, France and Japan to develop our own armored companies.

name: Irregular Tactics
description: The mountains, forests and cities have long been the only reliable allies for our armed forces. Our expertise in using asymmetrical warfare has served us well in the past and it will keep doing so in the future as well.

name: Decentralised Chain of Command
description: It's essential that our soldiers and officers act on their own initiative. While our enemy lays idle while waiting for instructions from the head of the army, our brave men will use their own heads instead!

name: Night Warfare
description: The darkness of night may blind conventional armies, but we've learned how to use it as an asset. Even an open field can be turned into an ambush spot and provide cover from enemy detection and fire. We'd be fools not to make the most of it.

name: Army of Shadows
description: We'll defeat our foes not by sacrificing our soldiers in head-on assaults, but with a thousand cuts from the shadows. Behind their lines, in their cities and even from within their ranks - there nowhere will our enemies find safety. Deception and cunning will win the day, not the foolhardy sacrifices of soldiers so many careless warlords commit.

name: Professional Legacy
description: Most of our commanders trace our military roots back to the esteemed Baoding Military Academy and many more are influenced by its teachings. We must build upon this legacy and turn Sichuan's army into a professional and disciplined military force worthy of respect.

name: Military Education Corps
description: Far too often military teachings put emphasis on the officers, with little regard for the education of the soldiers. With the right education, not only will our soldiers know how to drill and march, but they'll also have a keen eye for doctrine and its applications on a tactical level as well.

name: Well-Trained Officers
description: Many of China's modern heroes learned how to fight in the Baoding Military Academy. Carrying this legacy forward, we must make sure to do our utmost to ensure that as many of China's future heroes are trained in our academies. In producing excellent officers, even the Europeans will have to learn to respect us.

name: Army of Professionals
description: Much of China's suffering has come from warlords and corrupt officials pretending that an unruly mob can act as an army - let alone take a city without behaving like bandits in the process. We shall instead create an army of well-trained soldiers and officers, one that will fight for China with discipline and honor in equal measure.

name: Doctrinal Innovation
description: An army is only as good as its doctrine. If we don't adapt to the modern battlefield and its conditions, we'll be left in the dustbin of history. It's high time that we refine our tactics and strategies.

name: Equipment Standardisation
description: During the days of the warlords, any logistics officer would often have the unenviable burden of every local war band, governor militia and splinter force having their own rifles, ammunition and uniforms. More steps need to be taken to streamline our equipment, from the smallest manufacturing floors, all the way into the battlefield.

name: Engineer Units
description: Our home of Sichuan is a harsh landscape to fight in with its tall mountains and wide rivers. As such, specialized detachments of engineers ought to be used as much as possible to allow our forces to build the best defenses and surmount the mightiest of fortifications.

name: Improved Army Drills
description: It is true that while our soldiers are disciplined and brave, our training methods sometimes leave something to be desired as our training methods haven't always kept pace with other developments. We need to refine our methods and make sure our soldiers perform to the utmost of their ability.

name: Creative Solutions
description: Sichuan and indeed most surrounding provinces are inhospitable for any army and difficult to traverse. A clever and cost-effective solution to the restrictions on mobility could be the widespread implementation of bicycle infantry, proven by the previous war in Europe to be effective even in some of the most demanding war zones.

name: Army Drills
description: For far too long, the warlords of Sichuan were content with their forces resembling bandits more than actual soldiers. To mark a clear break from this past, the Chongqing high command is preparing for a program of province-wide army drilling and retraining. With enough effort, we'll have soldiers that are the most disciplined in all of China!

name: The Mighty Navy
description: Our capital of Chongqing rests near the Yangtze river, leaving it rather vulnerable to naval attacks from downriver, but also making it into a perfect base for the future navy of Sichuan. Eventually, a mighty armada of ships shall patrol the rivers, protecting our trade and people from banditry and showing our might to the rest of China.

name: The Mighty Air Force
description: Why should we scale the mountains of Sichuan to meet every threat when planes can simply attack them from the air? We'll start by importing foreign technology to use as a base. Once we're done, our air force will be the greatest in all of China, able to protect our skies and strike any foe!

name: Adopt Radio Communications
description: Modern wars are increasingly fought with the help of radio, radar and computing machines. It's therefore crucial for our modernization program that we procure and develop new advances in these fields and that our forces, down to every company, receive training in their use.

name: Dedicated Logistics Units
description: Even after our army becomes the mightiest in China - at least on paper - it'll be helpless in the field without a steady stream of supplies to keep it marching forward. By utilizing Chongqing's industry, we'll set up specialized supply trains that will be the envy of all Chinese military planners!

name: Large Front Operations
description: The key to winning battles is to properly utilize the vast manpower of Sichuan to wear down and overwhelm our foes. While a common warlord would simply use them as a bludgeon, we'll develop sophisticated methods for using large infantry charges as our spearheads, including the management and rapid deployment of reserves.

name: Reverse-Engineer Modern Weapons
description: It'd be a waste to simply distribute the foreign equipment we have acquired to the troops. To make the most of it, we'll dispatch our brightest military engineers to reverse-engineer them so that we can produce our own, superior variants.

name: Heavy Firepower Tactics
description: It's clear that we need to double our efforts to produce qualified artillery officers, since many of them still use their batteries in the most rudimentary ways. When we're done reforming our training methods, our artillery will shake the earth itself with mighty barrages ahead of every offensive we launch!

name: Armament Production Innovations
description: We cannot call our army truly modernized unless we develop our own modern arms. We'll pour more funds into our military R&D department so that they have the means to produce new weapons, made from the ground up by Chinese hands.

name: The Industrial Army
description: All our efforts to modernize have borne fruit. Our now mighty army has perfected the fusion of both military and industrial might to overwhelm any foe. Thanks to our industries, we can amass more guns, bullets, bombs and shells to use against our foes than anyone else in China. Let them tremble before the might of the Industrial Army!

name: Industrial Victory
description: The dice were cast and Liu Xiang's gamble paid off. The Zhili may have denied him the governorship in the past, but now he holds all of Sichuan in his iron fist. A man of great ambitions, he's unlikely to stop here.

name: Consolidate the Province
description: The war has been won and the petty warlords vanquished, but we can't rest on our laurels. There is plenty of work to be done and we must take steps to secure or victory and expand our base of power beyond Chongqing, by force if others make it necessary.

name: Align the Minor Warlords
description: Even though our rivals are dead or exiled, several lesser warlords remain with their own militias, posing a threat to our power. Some of them can be brought on board by integrating them into our armies and police forces and the rest can surely be pacified once their numbers become irrelevant.

name: Entice the Urban Merchants
description: Order cannot be maintained at gunpoint alone. If we are to succeed, we need to win over the region's wealthy bourgeoise, small as it may be, to our cause. With the right mix of carrots and the occasional stick, we're sure that they'll see the benefits of siding with us.

name: Family Matters
description: One of the most prominent figures of the defeated Baoding Department in Sichuan is Liu Wenhui, the warlord of Xikang and also Liu Xiang's uncle. It's an unfortunate state of affairs, but one which will have to be addressed one way or another. Liu Xiang hopes he'll come to his senses, but is nonetheless prepared for the worst should he be stubborn in his opposition.

name: Form the National Protection Alliance
description: It's finally time for the independent governors of China to assert themselves against the Beijing regime. [SZC.GetLeader] will therefore try to create an alliance between us and our like-minded partners in the region against the Zhili. Once they're finally dealt with, the rest should surely fall in line behind our leadership.

name: A Grandiose Plan
description: Ever since Liu Xiang was denied the governorship of Sichuan, the Zhili and their lapdogs have done nothing but hold us back. We can only tolerate this for so long. It's high time that [SZC.GetLeader] marched his army into Beijing and shattered them, once and for all - uniting all of China under his rule if he has to.

name: Towards Unification
description: We'll march towards the eventual and inevitable unification of China under the wise stewardship of [SZC.GetLeader]. Step by step, province by province, this new republic of ours will unite these lands under its banner once and for all!

name: The Lord of Sichuan
description: With [SZC.GetLeader]'s undisputed rule over Sichuan now a fact, the age of bickering warlords is finally over. Now that all the pieces are on place and any potential threat to the Industrial Corps has been either destroyed or pacified, we can finally forge ahead and decide Sichuan's fate for ourselves.

name: Famine Relief Corps
description: The people - or our soldiers, for that matter - cannot feed themselves from bark, grass and clay. Since the recent civil war created countless prisoners of war from the traitorous factions, we'll offer them the prospect of amnesty in exchange for tilling the fallow fields and preparing the distribution of food. Under close watch of our soldiers, of course.

name: Aggressive Modernisation
description: The old regime evidently didn't bother to catch up with the rest of the China. Instead, it clearly neglected its duty to its people and now we're the backwater of China. Our people will need to work hard to make up for the past decade's neglect and we'll make sure it bears fruit.

name: Fund the Construction Industry
description: Yang Sen was content to simply lord over fields of opium that wouldn't look out of place in the worst periods of the 19th century. If we are to bring Sichuan into the new era, however, the state will need to invest big in order to make it happen. Spare no expenses today, so that the next generation will be prosperous!

name: Expand Arms Production
description: The original ambitions of Liu Xiang always accounted for the inevitability of war. The Industrial Corps rose to prominence through conflict, and we're unlikely to bring peace to China without more bloodshed. Whether it's defensive or offensive, we need to arm ourselves for fend off our future foes as well.

name: The Riches of Xikang
description: The wealth of Xikang lays mostly untapped beneath the mountains. We'll need a modern steel industry so that our mighty military can march into battle with the rifles, cannons, vehicles and ships that they need.

name: Mass Education Campaigns
description: It wasn't just the cities that were neglected by the old Qing overlords and their stooges, but the minds of Sichuan's people as well. Illiteracy runs rampant and most people are clueless as to their rich history and duty to the state. Our literate officers shall act as teachers and the masses will learn by the millions.

name: Currency Reform
description: Before we defeated our rivals, every local province's warlord had their own worthless currency. That is, if they weren't even relegated to an ancient barter economy. Now that we're in charge, it's time we stamp out these vestiges of the past and start to use one united currency for one united Sichuan.

name: Sichuan Central Bank
description: Up until recently much of Sichuan's economy has been splintered into various local financial ecosystems under local mayors and warlords. By finally creating a centralized banking system with its beating heart centered in Chongqing we will be able to break this trend and drive our economy in one unified direction.

name: Standardise Land Tax
description: The old tax system was was a byzantine mess. Depending on which province you were in, it was either broken, inefficient or a governor's attempt to rob the people blind. We'll do away with this nonsense and implement our own centralized tax law, free from the grift and inefficiency of the past.

name: Urban Expansion
description: We cannot call ourself a modern nation unless we urbanise. We must encourage people to move in from the countryside and devote everything into expanding our cities. After we're done, Chongqing and Chengdu may well be the envy of Shanghai and Hong Kong!

name: Preserve the Monarchy
description: The Flemish may have kicked us out but the rule of Adelbert shall continue in the south.

name: Consolidate Royal Power
description: Once again it has been proven that only through harsh actions the population can be kept under control/

name: Form Royal Guard
description: We can't keep depending on the Feldgendarmerie, we need a strong and loyal royal guard.

name: Strengthen German Ties
description: Good relations with Berlin are vital for our reign as without them all may collapse once more.

name: Appoint a Royal Councillor
description: The Royal Councillor is our direct link to Parliament which he observes and intervenes in on our behalf. While [GetHeadOfGovernment] has served us well in the past few years, the recent uprisings may have caused the end of his career.

name: Adapt the Constitution
description: The political systems of our nation have changed drastically and a revision of the old Flanders-Walloon constitution is in order.

name: Give Up Our Belgian Claims
description: We should no longer strive for the conquest of Flanders. We are stronger on our own and can better focus on the needs of the Walloon people without them.

name: Liberals Strengthen Control
description: After their victory in the election and the use of their coalition to maneuvre them into an ideal position, they can finally focus on strengthening their own control over the total picture.

name: Le Chant des Wallons
description: Nationalism has been reinforced, the nation strengthened and new opportunities appear at every corner. Guided by our national anthem and the will of our people will we march towards the horizon!

name: Reaffirm Belgian Claims
description: The Flemish may have gotten the best of us during their revolution but the lion has been licking its wounds under the guise of a rooster. Soon we shall strike and take back our rightful land.

name: War Games on the Flemish Border
description: The Flemish invasion is imminent and close observation and training along the border may provide us with the edge we need.

name: Lobby Abroad
description: After their independence they were able to escape our wrath under the wing of Germany. We need to prove to Wilhelm that we are capable of holding the region and that splitting it up is detrimental to his greater vision.

name: Send the Ultimatum
description: The time for war has come. Flanders will bow beneath the rooster and will rejoin our union.

name: Reform into a Republic
description: The monarchy has proven to be a failure and has been replaced by the Walloon Republic

name: Hold Elections
description: With tensions high between the POB, PL and German royalists, elections have to be held as soon as possible to bring stability back to our nation.

name: Invite the Catholics
description: To secure a total majority in Parliament and consolidate our power base, we'll need the support from the Catholics in the south.

name: Invite the Socialists
description: We have to extend the olive branch to our friends in the POB to guide the way towards a stable and prosperous society.

name: Form a Government
description: The first round of negotiations has proven successful and it's now time to finalise the formation and announce the new Walloon government.

name: Syndicalist Revolution
description: The syndicalist revolution has arrived and is sweeping through the industrial centres of the Sillon Industriel. A steady hand will be necessary to avoid bloodshed and violence.

name: Peaceful Transition
description: The only way to truly win over the heart of the working class is by fair and democratic elections. Through a solid parliamentary powerbase, we'll start reforming and shaping Wallonia into our socialist ideal.

name: A POB President
description: Fernand Dehousse has led the party through the elections and should be the undisputed leader of the party. As the first Walloon president, he will guide Wallonia towards the future.

name: A Syndicalist Chairman
description: Fernand Dehousse has grown soft and has abandonned all what the Syndicalist revolution stood for. He will need to be replaced by a true syndicalist so the revolution can continue.

name: Nationalise the Basic Industry
description: The Steel and Coal industry is our most important industrial branch but is nearly entirely controlled by Walloon and German capitalists. If we were to take control over these important sectors we can secure that workers are placed above profits.

name: Found the National Mining Company
description: To avoid an industrial collapse on the scale of Black Monday, we need to create a state-owned mining company to control and subsidise our own coal mines to secure the jobs of our people.

name: Expand State Education
description: To reduce the influence of the Catholics, we need to prove that state education can be just as good or even better.

name: Abolish Catholic Education
description: Through their vast education system, the Cathoics control the mind and spirit of our youth. Church and Education should be completely seperated and the latter be made solely state controlled.

name: Introduce Women's Suffrage
description: Some of our voters are starting to doubt whether the POB will stay on the revolutionary path or is starting to drift off into a status quo complacency. Therefore the leader of the Party has announced that he will press for voting rights for all citizens : men and women.

name: The POB Retains Control
description: With most large scale reforms passed, the popularity of the POB is reaching new heights prompting a stronger position for the coming elections.

name: Disband the Parliamentary System
description: It has become clear that a Syndicalist Revolution is the only way forward for Wallonia and therefore the POB has pushed for the complete abolition of the parliamentary structure, with it to be replaced with a syndicalist system based on our French neighbour.

name: Declare the Walloon Commune
description: The time has come for the workers to rise up and break the chains. The Walloon Commune will be declared ushering in a new era!

name: Join the Internationale
description: With ties between Wallonia and Germany completely collapsing, we need the support of our brethren in France to secure the continuation of the revolution.

name: Revolution By Force
description: It's clear that the workers need to be shaken out of their oppression and united by a strong leader.

name: Seize Royal Assets
description: The Royal Treasure has steadily been filled with the gains of our sweat. It is only right that those assets are returned to the working man at once.

name: Combat Military Disorder
description: With large disagreements erupting in the army between the German royalists and democratic supporters, we need a large scale cleanup of these resisting elements to restore order.

name: Fight the Establishment
description: The ruling class has been growing rich on the back of our work and will now have to pay for their treason.

name: Defeat Loyalist Remnants
description: Funded by Walloon and German capitalists, resisting cells of the former army have dug themselves in across the nation to resist to the last man against the Revolution.

name: Seize German Companies
description: The German companies have infested the Sillon Industriel and abused our population to finance the German Empire. No more!

name: Unite the POB
description: The POB is still divided due to moderate elements in the party. These will have to be eliminated or 'persuaded' to join our cause.

name: Hold the First Party Congress
description: The Revolution is in full sway and to announce their plans for the coming years, the POB leadership has announced the First Party Congress. Experts and important figures from the Commune of France, the Union of Britain and Italy have all been invited.

name: The Government Has Failed
description: The pathetic excuse of a government has finally been overthrown and has been replaced by a strong and centralised government surrounding Degrelle.

name: Sideline the King
description: The power of the king should be severly cut back as his constant meddling with government affairs has proven detrimental to our stability.

name: Replace Our Ambassador to Germany
description: To further outline our change in policy, the ambassador to Germany will be recalled and replaced by a close friend of Degrelle.

name: The Revolution Has Failed
description: The syndicalist revolution was a disgraceful ruse to trick the population in becoming slaves of the evil POB leadership. They should be happy that we are 'liberating' them from their own ambitions.

name: Imprison Syndicalist Leadership
